* Professional training and certification (e.g., SAP Enterprise Architecture Framework featured by LeanIX EAM, SAP Certified Professional-Enterprise Architect [P\_SAPEA\_2023], TOGAF) as a plus.


**Bring out your best**
 SAP innovations help more than four hundred thousand customers worldwide work together more efficiently and use business insight more effectively. Originally known for leadership in enterprise resource planning (ERP) software, SAP has evolved to become a market leader in end-to-end business application software and related services for database, analytics, intelligent technologies, and experience management. As a cloud company with two hundred million users and more than one hundred thousand employees worldwide, we are purpose-driven and future-focused, with a highly collaborative team ethic and commitment to personal development. Whether connecting global industries, people, or platforms, we help ensure every challenge gets the solution it deserves. At SAP, you can bring out your best.
   

  

**We win with inclusion**
 SAP’s culture of inclusion, focus on health and well-being, and flexible working models help ensure that everyone – regardless of background – feels included and can run at their best. At SAP, we believe we are made stronger by the unique capabilities and qualities that each person brings to our company, and we invest in our employees to inspire confidence and help everyone realize their full potential. We ultimately believe in unleashing all talent and creating a better and more equitable world.
   

  

 SAP is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to the values of Equal Employment Opportunity and provide accessibility accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team: Careers@sap.com
   

  

 For SAP employees: Only permanent roles are eligible for the SAP Employee Referral Program, according to the eligibility rules set in the SAP Referral Policy. Specific conditions may apply for roles in Vocational Training.
   

  

**EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability**
 Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their age, race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, age, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, et al), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, or disability.
   

  

 Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.
   

  

 Requisition ID: 395895 | Work Area: Consulting and Professional Services | Expected Travel: 0 - 10% | Career Status: Professional | Employment Type: Regular Full Time | Additional Locations: Virtual - Denmark .

title: Upphandlare inom LOU till Roslagsvatten
description:
**Tjänstebeskrivning & erbjudande**
 Roslagsvatten befinner sig i mitten av en spännande förändringsresa – en resa som vi kallar Roslagsvatten 2.0. Våra kommuner växer och utvecklas i hög takt och för att möta morgondagens behov behöver vi ställa om och utveckla vår verksamhet med lösningar som är hållbara över tid.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som idag upphandlar varor eller tjänster enligt LOU och vill komma till ett växande bolag där vi upphandlar varor, tjänster och entreprenader för över 400 miljoner kronor varje år.
   

  

 Enheten består av 7 medarbetare, en inköpschef, upphandlare, entreprenadupphandlare, inköpscontroller och inköpssamordnare där du kommer att leda ett varierat utbud av upphandlingar, såsom IT-tjänster, företagshälsovård samt material till pumpstationer och reningsverk.
   

  

 Tillsammans med kollegorna kommer du att ansvara för att upphandlingar som görs sker i enlighet med lagar, regler och vår upphandlingspolicy samt att de genomförs på ett affärsmässigt och professionellt sätt.
   

  

 Arbetsuppgifter
   

  

* Ansvara för planering och genomförande av upphandlingar med skiftande komplexitet inom olika varu- och tjänstekategorier, eventuellt kommer du kommer även att få stötta vid upphandling av entreprenader.
* Genomföra direktupphandlingar och förnyade konkurrensutsättningar.
* Ta fram behovs- och marknadsanalyser tillsammans med verksamheten och arbeta fram upphandlingsstrategier.
* Leda, planera och driva upphandlingsarbetet i både investeringsprojekt och löpande upphandlingar.
* Arbeta med avtalsuppföljning.
* Arbeta med upphandlingsmallar och processer.


**Personprofil**
 Vi söker dig som har några års arbetslivserfarenhet som upphandlare eller inköpare inom offentlig sektor där du fått erfarenhet av att arbeta enligt LOU.
   

  

 Alternativt har du en relevant yrkesutbildning inom upphandling/inköp och har genom praktik fått erfarenhet av att tillämpa LOU.
   

  

 Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet av att ha arbetat med kategoristyrning och det är även meriterande om du upphandlar tjänster inom IT.
   

  

 Vi söker vi dig som är trygg i din yrkesroll, du är kommunikativ och affärsdriven. Du är en person med god pedagogisk förmåga och hög servicekänsla. Du kommer att möta och samarbeta med kollegor på olika nivåer och i olika funktioner, därför är din flexibilitet och din förmåga att kommunicera viktig. Vi uppskattar att du som upphandlare är noggrann och strukturerad, trivs i en roll där du arbetar självständigt, och samtidigt förstår vikten av samarbete och att vara en del av en större helhet.
   

  

**Övrigt**
 Roslagsvatten AB är ett kommunägt bolag med cirka 220 medarbetare som arbetar med dricksvatten, rening av avloppsvatten, hämtning av hushållsavfall samt återvinning av avfall. Verksamheten präglas av ett stort engagemang och högt tekniskt kunnande. Bolaget omsätter ca 650mkr.
   

  

 Start: Omgående, enligt överenskommelse
   

  

 Omfattning: Heltid och tillsvidare
   

  

 Arbetstid: Kontorstider, flextid
   

  

 Arbetsplats: Åkersberga
   

  

 PerformIQ är vår samarbetspartner och vi hänvisar eventuella frågor om tjänsten till Rekryteringskonsult Mattias Söderberg på mattias.soderberg@performiq.se. Skicka in din ansökan redan idag då intervjuer sker löpande.
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

**Kontaktuppgifter Till Fackliga Företrädare**
 Saco: Carina Asp, telefonnummer 08-540 835 07, e-post: carina.asp@roslagsvatten.se
   

  

 Vision: Emil Sjöberg, telefonnummer 08-598 428 79, e-post: emil.sjoberg@roslagsvatten.se

title: Working Student in Underwriting Property (m/f/d)
description:
**Let’s care for tomorrow.
   

  

 Your ambitions. Your dreams. Your tomorrow**
 Whether it’s aircraft, international business or offshore wind parks, Allianz Commercial has an extensive range of risks covered when it comes to protecting businesses.
   

  

 We are looking for a Working Student (m/f/d) for our Property team, based in Stockholm.
   

  

**Your Team**
 Our team is committed to providing industrial insurance solutions for corporate clients across Denmark, Finland, Norway, and Sweden. We foster a flexible, diverse, and high-performing business culture. You’ll work alongside highly professional and experienced colleagues, while being in close contact with our customers and brokers. As part of a business that leads in Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR), you'll contribute to meaningful solutions and initiatives that drive positive impact.
   

  

**The Impact You Will Have**
 As a working student your main tasks are providing an effective and efficient administration and processing service to support the rest of the team.
   

  

**Some Of Your Specific Responsibilities Could Include**
* Participate in the due diligence process
* Prepare and issue business documentation
* Update databases and business transaction systems
* Support and service our clients and distribution partners


**What You’ll Bring To The Role**
* Currently enrolled as a university student with at least 1-2 years remaining in your studies
* Interest in working with global corporate insurance solutions
* Proficient in Microsoft Office applications (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, etc.)
* Enthusiastic about collaborating with international colleagues
* Proactive and logical thinker with a problem-solving mindset
* Strong communication skills in at least one Scandinavian language (Norwegian, Swedish, or Danish)
* Excellent oral and written English skills, as English is our corporate language


**Further Information:**
* Duration at least 6 months (preferably longer) with good opportunity for extension
* Working hours: 15 hours/week
* Enrollment at the university/college is a prerequisite for the duration of employment.


 56916 | Underwriting | Student | Allianz Commercial | Part-Time | Temporary
   

  

**What’s in it for you?**
**Let’s Care About Everything That Makes You, You**
 We are committed to nurturing an inclusive environment where everyone feels they belong. We offer a hybrid working model, which recognizes the value of striking a balance between in-person collaboration and remote working. Please feel free to discuss flexible working arrangements with us.
   

  

**Let’s care for your financial wellbeing**
 We believe in rewarding performance with a great compensation and benefits package (details vary by location), including a generous bonus scheme and pension.
   

  

**Let’s care for your opportunities to progress**
 From career development and digital learning programs to international career mobility, we offer lifelong learning for our employees worldwide and an environment where innovation, delivery and empowerment are fostered.
   

  

**Let’s care for life’s twists and turns**
 From our support for flexible working, health and wellbeing (including private healthcare and generous parental leave benefits), to helping people return from career breaks with experience that nothing else can teach. We've got your back.
   

  

**Let’s care for our society and our planet**
 With opportunities to be engaged in shaping a future that is safe, inclusive and sustainable, we care for the tomorrows of our people, our industry and our clients.
   

  

**Care to join us?**
 Allianz Commercial is the Allianz Group brand serving the world’s largest consumer brands and major industry players through to family-owned enterprises forming the backbone of nations’ economies. We bring together the corporate multinational business of Allianz Global Corporate & Specialty and the commercial business of national Allianz Property & Casualty entities and provide both traditional and alternative risk transfer solutions, outstanding risk consulting and Multinational services as well as seamless claims handling.
   

  

 As a key strategic player in the Allianz Group network, Allianz Commercial is present in over 200 countries and in 2022 generated more than €19 billion gross premium.
   

  

 Learn more about careers at Allianz Commercial by clicking here .
   

  

 Learn more about Allianz Commercial by clicking here .
   

  

 Allianz is an equal opportunity employer, and therefore welcomes applications regardless of ethnicity or cultural background, age, gender, nationality, religion, disability, sexual orientation or any other protected characteristic. Diversity of thinking is an important part of our culture.
   

  

**People with disabilities:**
 We want to give all our candidates the best opportunity to succeed. If you need any adjustments to be made during the application and selection process, please email agcsglobalcareers@allianz.com
   

  

**Recruitment Agencies:**
 Allianz Commercial has an in-house recruitment team, which focuses on sourcing great candidates directly. Allianz Commercial does not accept unsolicited resumes from agency or search firm recruiters. Fees will not be paid in the event a candidate submitted by a recruiter without an agreement in place is hired. When we do use agencies, we have a PSL in place, so please do not contact managers directly.

title: TDD/ESG Specialist
description:
**About JLL**
 We are JLL. We’re a professional services and investment management firm specializing in real estate. We’re committed to our purpose to shape the future of real estate for a better world. Our mission is to help organizations around the world achieve their ambitions by owning, occupying and investing in real estate.
   

  

 If you’re looking to step up your career, JLL is the perfect professional home. At JLL, you’ll have a chance to innovate with the world’s leading businesses, put that expertise into action on landmark projects, and work on game-changing real estate initiatives. You’ll also make long-lasting professional connections through sharing different perspectives, and you’ll be inspired by the best. We’re focused on opportunity and want to help you make the most of yours. Achieve your ambitions – join us at JLL!
   

  

**We are looking for a TDD/ESG Specialist to strengthen our Swedish Building Consultancy & ESG team**
**About Project And Development Services (PDS)**
 JLL is a world class real estate development partner for our investor and corporate clients. Our services affect how millions of people live, work, and play every day. It is our responsibility to nurture the impact we can have on all projects and bring value into every detail. From technical due diligence to sustainability and development advisory, from project and cost management for fit-out projects to refurbishments and major base-build schemes, our services span every dimension across all asset types, sectors and regions.
   

  

 JLL’s PDS team comprises 8,900 project managers, engineers, designers and architects across 50 countries and is actively managing 36,900+ projects yearly. Join the PDS team to expect more and achieve more. There’s room for you to design and build your career within the PDS community and the wider JLL ecosystem.
   

  

 In Sweden, PDS comprises of project managers within the Building Consultancy, Corporate Project Management, Development Advisory and Construction Management teams. The Building Consultancy team has a major focus on assisting clients in undertaking Technical & Environmental Due Diligence (TEDD) assessments prior to acquisition or disposal of assets. In addition, our team undertake ESG assessments as part of transactions or as part of improvement strategies post-acquisition to improve assets from a sustainability and value perspective.
   

  

 JLLs Building Consultancy team want to expand further to meet increased demands from clients in helping with TEDD assessments and especially ESG related queries. We assist both global and local Nordic clients in transaction advisory and asset improvement strategies concerning ESG and sustainability related items. ESG and sustainability services include but are not limited to EPC uplift assessments, energy saving and improvement calculations, building certifications, Net-Zero carbon assessments including CRREM analysis as well as climate risk assessments and EU Taxonomy compliance.
   

  

**Main Responsibilities**
 Within the Building Consultancy department, you will provide technical advisory services for and on behalf of property companies/funds, investors and public players. Projects can vary between small scale single properties to large portfolios throughout EMEA. We are actively seeking a TDD/ESG specialist who wants to become an integral part of our diverse and talented Building Consultancy team. We summarise below the main responsibilities:
   

  

* Meaningful Impact: As a TDD/ESG specialist, you will play a critical role in helping clients make sound investment decisions by assessing the condition of the building and technical installations, providing CAPEX cost estimates, and give strategic advice to help clients in determining go/no-go decisions before acquisition/disposal.
* Key Skills: You are proficient in preparing technical reports and cost estimates such as condition surveys, maintenance plans and due diligence assessments. You actively seek new client contacts and leads and business opportunities. Your key skills in technical report writing and active client engagement will be put into action daily as you create new business opportunities, undertake assessments, and provide valuable insights to clients in a timely manner.
* Focus on ESG and Sustainability: Familiarity with building certification systems such as BREEAM, Miljöbyggnad. Ideally, you have worked with some of these systems or have experience in conducting assessments and identifying improvements. As a TDD/ESG specialist, you will be involved in energy-saving assessments (EPC improvement) and reducing the carbon impact of assets (via CRREM/LCA assessments).
* Wider Sustainability Services: You will actively collaborate with team members assisting with environmental desktop assessments (EDD), climate risk assessments, Life Cycle Assessments (LCA), EU Taxonomy and CSRD.


**Experience And Knowledge**
* Minimum five years’ experience working in property branch including some experience with TEDD projects, sustainable development, maintenance planning, facilities management and/or project management.
* Demonstrate a keen interest in identifying opportunities for improvements relating to cost and energy savings
* Exhibit fluent proficiency in spoken and written English and Swedish.
* Have experience with or a strong interest in working with building certification systems such as BREEAM, Miljöbyggnad. Familiarity with EPC systems including improvement assessments and recommendations.


**Personal qualities**
 You should have the ability to quickly form an overall picture of complex issues and are not afraid to make decisions. As a person, you describe yourself as prestige less and easy to work with. For the role, it is important that you are someone who can build and maintain good relationships with colleagues and clients while taking great pride in doing a good job, at all levels. Furthermore, we believe that you:
   

  

* Have the ability to handle the demands of managing multiple projects simultaneously with tight deadlines.
* Appreciate and thrive in an international corporate environment, leveraging cultural diversity and global perspectives. Are business driven with a holistic approach
* Are outgoing and a good networker and relationship builder. See opportunities, enjoys challenges and has a positive attitude. Have energy, perseverance, and an inner drive. Have a high level of commitment, initiative, and flexibility


**Teamworking and active collaboration within JLL;**
* You enjoy working within teams throughout Europe and with different business lines within JLL (Capital Markets, Valuation, Leasing, Debt&Financing) to create value for clients and help them in determining strategy and targets regarding ESG matters and investment decisions
* Collaborate with colleagues to identify and secure new project opportunities, effectively presenting and selling the company's services.
* Contribute to the continuous development of internal structures and processes, streamlining project workflows and enhancing overall efficiency.


**What You Can Expect From Us**
 Collaborative and Inclusive Team Environment: We foster a supportive and inclusive team environment where diverse perspectives are valued, and ideas are encouraged. Join our team and contribute to a culture of collaboration, mutual respect, and innovation.
   

  

 Travel and Networking Opportunities: This role offers the opportunity to work on projects across the Nordics, allowing you to broaden your professional horizons and establish valuable connections within the industry. You will have the possibility to expand your network of clients and contacts, creating new opportunities and projects (within Nordics but also EMEA).
   

  

 Professional Development: We offer training programs to ensure that our team members are up to date with the latest industry standards (including building certification training plus JLL ESG training). You will have the opportunity to enhance your knowledge and skills to further advance your career.
   

  

 You will be involved in growing our project management business. You will be involved in providing strategic advice to many of Sweden’s and some of the world’s largest property and asset management funds in relation to Due Diligence and sustainability (via energy improvements).
   

  

 You will work in an international and interdisciplinary work environment together with many competent and ambitious colleagues. JLL will strive to enable you to develop via introducing you team members throughout EMEA who work with similar fields to build collaboration and improve services for clients.
   

  

 You’ll join an entrepreneurial, inclusive culture. One where we succeed together – across the desk and around the globe. Where like-minded people work naturally together to achieve great things.
   

  

 Our Total Rewards program reflects our commitment to helping you achieve your ambitions in career, recognition (including bonus system), wellbeing, benefits and pay.
   

  

 Apply today at jll.com/careers.
   

  

**JLL Corporate Solutions AB**
**Tom Lord**
**Head of Building Consultancy (TEDD GDD ESG)**
 Tom.lord@jll.com

title: Client Success Manager 🇸🇪⭐️
description:
**Are you an experienced Client Success professional who is in for a growth adventure in a newly PE backed scaled-up? And would you like to work with some of the most acknowledged Retail brands and build personalized employee engagement apps?** 
**🤩**
 Then read along because we at Relesys are looking for a hands-on
 **Client Success Manager** 
 to join our team in Stockholm 🚀 💪
   

  

 As a Client Success Manager, you will be the "face of Relesys" and become our client's best friend and trusted advisor. You will work eagerly to understand your client's business, the users of our software, and the possibilities with how their personalised app can empower their frontline workforce and connect them to HQ! We have a highly collaborative team where you will work closely with the sales team, implementation team, digital designers, and product team to make sure our Client's app shines and is as unique as they are to us!
   

  

 We are already working with clients like Peak performance, Gina Tricot, Bauhaus, Carlsberg, Tiger of Sweden, etc., which are amazing brands and proof of the quality and reputation of our product, service, and attention to detail that we always provide to our clients. Our clients are not just considered our customers, but we consider them our colleagues with whom we build strong and long-term relationships 🤩
   

  

 This is an exciting and transformative time to join Relesys, as we have just gone into a strategic partnership with the Private Equity fund, Copilot Capital, where the coming years will bring extensive growth and opportunities along the way. You get a unique opportunity to make a tremendous impact in taking your career, Relesys and our dear clients to the next level over the coming years - as we say it, joining a scale-up at this stage is a rare opportunity that is "once in a lifetime opportunity" 🤩
   

  

**Your key responsibilities:‍**
 As Client Success Manager your role will include, but will not be limited to:
   

  

* Carry out the best customer experience for a large amount of diverse clients within the SMB segment
* Own the primary relation to your clients with a deep understanding of their motivations, business drivers, strategic goals, and desired outcomes
* Guide the clients through changes, adoption, and value realization of their solution, unlocking growth and customer advocacy initiatives
* Become a product expert, advising your customers on how to best leverage our platform via best practices, use cases, learnings from other customers, etc.
* Assist the configuration of the client's platform in supporting the client's needs and driving value for their organization
* Partner with the Client Success leadership team across Relesys to further refine the structure, systems, and resources to support our clients successfully
* Work closely with internal teams (Support, Solution Engineers, Marketing, Sales, Product, and Development) to align priorities, collaborate on customer needs and opportunities, and deliver early and increasing value over time


**Who Are You**
* 2-3 years of experience managing a larger portfolio of clients
* Comfortable with a fast-paced environment, working across multiple projects and clients at one time
* Have a commercial mindset
* Are an emphatic and passionate person who takes great pride in providing an exceptional client experience
* Are self-driven, proactive, and ambitious with a great understanding of the importance of a strong team
* Strong analytical skills & data-driven mindset to evaluate performance and make adequate operational decisions
* Are comfortable collaborating with diverse stakeholder groups and engaging with senior executives about technical business topics
* Experience in the SaaS industry is a plus but not a requirement
* It is an advantage if you have worked in retail, as you will be one bit closer to the everyday communication and alignment struggles of our Clients' employees
* You are located in or near Stockholm
* Have professional proficiency in both spoken and written English 🇬🇧
* Have fluent or bilingual proficiency in either Danish, Swedish or another Nordics language 🇩🇰🇸🇪🇳🇴🇫🇮


**What do we offer?**
* A unique opportunity to join a scale-up at this stage, as a rare "once in a lifetime" opportunity, making a tremendous impact in taking your career to the next level🚀
* Opportunities for professional growth and development as we are growing towards becoming a unicorn business
* Great level of responsibility from day one in a dynamic and international environment
* A collaborative and thriving office-first culture where team spirit and fun are at the heart of everything we do
* Positive and supportive colleagues who wish you to succeed 💫
* Competitive salary based on your experience and skills.
* Breakfast at the office every Tuesday
* Coffee and tea at the office ☕️
* Social initiatives like global summer parties and many other social events, as well as business travels to the CPH office🌟


**When and where do you start?**
* We are looking for a candidate to start January 2025!
* We are hoping to find a colleague for our office in Stockholm 🇸🇪
* Apply for the position by sending your CV through the Apply button


**We can't wait to hear from you! 🤩**
**Who are we?**
 Relesys isn't just another SaaS company; we are a dynamic force revolutionizing communication and performance management platforms. Established in 2014, we set out on a mission to bridge the gap between HQ and non-desk workers, fostering a thriving workforce.
   

  

 What value do we bring? People are the heartbeat of our client's business. When employees are thriving and successful, businesses flourish and retention rates increase. Relesys enables our clients to achieve this through an all-in-one app that streamlines communications, training, and daily operations into their own customized and ever-evolving app 📱
   

  

 With clients such as Salling Group, COOP, Carlsberg, and Vestas - to name just a few - Relesys serves clients in 15 different countries, supporting them in 33 languages with 395,000 licenses across 17,000 stores and users in 97 countries. We have a strong presence in the Nordics and EMEA, and we continue to increasingly attract clients from across the globe, as we are breaking into new, dynamic markets.
   

  

 At Relesys, we're shaping the future for frontline workers across various industries: Retail, Hospitality, Production/Manufacturing, and Transportation –
 *while having* 
**FUN** 
 , as our rule number one! Join us on this thrilling journey as we grow and venture into new horizons.
   

  

**Our Culture**
 Building a world-class organization and culture is our highest priority. We believe in the talent of our people and in long-term collaborations where we value an informal yet highly professional culture. We always go 'the extra mile' for our colleagues and clients, but rule number one - Have fun!
   

  

 This rule is always at the forefront of our minds when we come to work, creating an environment that is filled with passion, energy, and inspiration. We are eager to see what exciting contributions you, as our new colleague, will bring, as we believe that each and every individual has a tremendous influence on the whole 🌍

title: Director, Marketing (Data and Digital)
description:
**Work Schedule**
 Standard (Mon-Fri)
   

  

**Environmental Conditions**
 Office
   

  

*When you’re part of Thermo Fisher Scientific, you’ll do challenging work, and join a team that values performance, quality and innovation. As part of a successful, growing global organization you will be encouraged to perform at your best. With revenues of more than $40 billion and the largest investment in R&D in the industry, we give our people the resources and chances to create significant contributions to the world.*
**The job:**
 As Director, Marketing (Digital & Data), you will craft and implement a strategy to improve Fisher Scientific Europe’s commercial performance through data-driven marketing. You will coordinate teams dedicated to lead generation, paid media/SEO, on-site conversion, automation and analytics/intelligence. Collaboration with sales and portfolio functions, as well as other commercial divisions and centres of excellence, will be vital.
   

  

 You can learn more about the Fisher Scientific portfolio and eCommerce site here.
   

  

 This role is fully remote (work from home) based anywhere in Europe. Regular international travel – up to 20% pa – may be required.
   

  

**What will you do?**
* Lead and develop Fisher Scientific Europe’s data and digital team to strengthen its maturity and capability.
* Improve our data science programs by using predictive analytics, AI, and machine learning to find the best selling and marketing opportunities. Provide these insights to our sales teams and apply them to our marketing channels.
* Generate new customers, identify engaged website visitors, and boost findability for Fishersci products in the digital environment.
* Collaborate with sales leadership and sales operations to devise initiatives that align with sales objectives and targets. Use data science, commercial automation and digital programs to improve sales efficiency and optimization.
* Apply data to personalize customer engagement. Implement digital merchandising strategies to grow the market basket and convert customer sales.
* Help the analytics team draw out actionable insights and implications from customer and marketing data.
* Champion a strong and passionate team culture: Build inclusive work environments, cultivate talent, and encourage cross-functional integration, all while aligning with RSD EU priorities.
* Reporting to the Senior Director, Marketing, RSD Europe.


**Who we are looking for:**
**Education:**
* Master’s degree in Business, Marketing, Data Science, or a related field, or equivalent work experience.


**Experience:**
* Extensive experience leading data-driven digital marketing initiatives.
* A track record in B2C eCommerce or retail, with a strong focus on data strategy, digital transformation, and marketing innovation.
* A proven team leader who motivates and develops talent.


**Skills & Capabilities:**
* Knowledge of digital marketing technologies, including marketing automation, salesforce automation, predictive marketing, and targeted advertising.
* Experience planning and implementing digital marketing strategies across SEO/SEM, email marketing, display advertising, retargeting, and social media campaigns.
* Expertise in data science methodologies, including predictive analytics, AI, and machine learning, and their application to marketing and sales.
* Experience with conversion optimization, customer segmentation, and personalization to drive customer engagement and sales.
* Advanced level of English


**Collaboration & Customer Engagement:**
* Proven record of successful teamwork with sales and other cross-functional team members.
* Experience in demand generation and using data to identify and convert new leads.
* Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to present insights and strategies to senior leadership.


**Technical Proficiency:**
* Proficiency in data-driven marketing platforms and tools, including Salesforce, and data visualization tools.
* Familiarity with tools for commercial automation, digital merchandising, and driving sales efficiency through data.


**What’s in it for you:**
 We offer competitive remuneration, an annual incentive plan bonus scheme and a range of employee benefits! Thermo Fisher Scientific offers employment with an innovative, forward-thinking organization, and outstanding career and development prospects. We offer an exciting company culture that stands for integrity, intensity, involvement, and innovation.
   

  

**About us:**
 Our Mission is to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. Watch as our colleagues explain 5 reasons to work with us. As one team of 100,000+ colleagues, we share a common set of values - Integrity, Intensity, Innovation and Involvement - working together to accelerate research, solve complex scientific challenges, drive technological innovation and support patients in need. #StartYourStory at Thermo Fisher Scientific, where diverse experiences, backgrounds and perspectives are valued.
   

  

 Apply today! http://jobs.thermofisher.com
   

  

 Thermo Fisher Scientific is an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status.

title: CREW CONTROLLER
description:
**Crew Controller**
 Crew Control is responsible for the published schedule for all flying crew within SAS Scandinavia. The planning process includes Resource Planning, Crew Optimization, Training Planning and Crew Control.
   

  

**As a Crew Controller At SAS, You Will**
* To exercise Crew Control for SAS air traffic, which includes monitoring and implementation of all traffic decisions that may arise in the execution phase.
* Develop, propose and implement solutions to traffic and operational disruptions
* Recovery from irregular situations
* Commercial inquiries
* Extra production/ ad hoc
* Ensure correct service staffing
* Ensure good feasibility


 You will also ensure that traffic implementation is carried out within the framework of safety procedures and requirements for SAS operations decided by AM/NPH and relevant authorities. For example OM-A and FTL, current collective agreements, SAS commercial and operational strategy and SAS management policy. In addition, you will work on ensuring the best possible regularity, punctuality and cost effectiveness during daily operations, execution. Coordinate solutions, proposals and priorities together with other functions within OCC.
   

  

**To Be Successful, We Believe You Should Have**
* Several years of experience in a daily operations environment
* 3-year high school or equivalent
* Very good knowledge of English in speech and writing
* Very good knowledge of the Scandinavian languages, speech and writing.
* Good computer skills.


**Other Meritorious Qualifications**
* Experience in an operational environment, SAS or other.
* Insight in SAS`s production apparatus and processes
* Good knowledge of safety and regulatory requirements regarding SAS production
* Knowledge in within government regulations, OM-A/FTL
* Knowledge within CBA


**As a Person You Have**
* Good ability to prioritize and make decisions in stressful circumstances
* Very good co-operation ability
* Stress resistance
* Communicative
* Creative


 Other qualities that we value in our employees are openness and honesty and that you have the courage to stand up for your opinions and always strive to solve problems on the spot. You are a team player who engages with his colleagues and contributes to job satisfaction. You solve your task to the best of your ability, are responsive and make it easier for others to perform theirs. You are curious about what gives our customers the desire to travel, what is happening in the outside world and what is happening in other parts of the company. We also assume that you are customer- and result-oriented by striving to meet the customer's expectations, develop your own knowledge and share it with others, be committed to the company's future and goal fulfillment.
   

  

**Other Of Importance**
* Deadline for application: 2024-10-17
* Desired startdate: January/February 2025
* Position: Fulltime (100%) starting with a 6 month probation period
* This position is based in Frösundavik, Solna (Stockholm)
* A background check will be conducted on the selected candidate.


**Is this you? If so, come fly with us!**
 If you have questions about this position, you are warmly welcome to contact Cristin Rosengren at cristin.rosengren@sas.se. Please send your CV as soon as possible. Interviews are conducted continuously, and the position may be filled before the application deadline. We look forward to hearing from you!
   

  

**Why SAS?**
**Benefits**
 At SAS, we offer extensive opportunities for professional development in an international, fast-paced working environment. We are dedicated to the continuous growth of our employees. Working with us comes with a variety of benefits, including:
   

  

* Travel Perks: Enjoy discounted travel opportunities around the world with SAS.
* Health & Wellness: Access to health and wellness benefits, including a newly renovated gym with complimentary classes such as CrossFit and yoga.
* Discounts: Receive discounts from a wide range of brands, as well as on transportation to and from airports, airport shops, hotels, and car rentals.
* Work Environment: Our office location in Frösundavik offers a vibrant workspace with a restaurant, café, and easy access to outdoor activities in Hagaparken and Brunnsviken. Engage in running, tennis, outdoor gym sessions, kayaking, and stand-up paddling with equipment available free of charge.
* Convenient Commute: Benefit from a non-stop bus service connecting our office to Central Station, Solna station, and commuter trains, alongside a network of cycle paths.

title: Software Engineering Manager - Container and Virtualisation Infrastructure
description:
Our mission is to build a next-generation private cloud infrastructure, combining KVM, Ceph, and SDN technologies to create a data center scale cloud that 'just works' and provides a mission-critical cloud for edge and core enterprise deployments. We're hiring engineering managers with experience in high-quality microservice architectures and high-performance team leadership who also have deep familiarity with Linux kernel, virtualisation, storage and networking.
   

  

 LXD components span the entire software stack from low-level kernel features to the upper level management API/CLI. Our most effective engineers are fluent in all these layers, and able to anticipate the consequences of design and engineering choices elsewhere in a complex distributed system.
   

  

 As an engineering manager at Canonical you must have a solid technical background, but your responsibility is to run an effective team and develop the colleagues you manage. You are expected to help them grow as engineers, do important work, do it outstandingly well, find professional and personal satisfaction, and work well with colleagues and the community. Technical leadership experience and a background in software engineering are necessary prerequisites for this role. You will be expected to lead, challenge, and develop engineers, positively influence the culture, facilitate technical delivery, and work with your team on strategy and execution.
   

  

 The successful candidate will have experience leading successful, collaborative engineering teams, and demonstrate the ability to solve challenging distributed systems problems and deep knowledge of Linux.
   

  

***Location***
 : This is a remote position available in EMEA and the Americas.
   

  

 What you will focus on
   

  

* Lead a team of remote engineers
* Develop talent through coaching, mentoring, feedback and hands-on career development
* Set and manage expectations with other engineering teams, senior management, and external stakeholders
* Advocate and advance modern software development practices
* Participate in the engineering process through code and architectural review
* Engage with teams at Canonical, the open source community and partners
* Work from home with global travel for 4 to 6 weeks per year for internal and external events


 What we are looking for in you
   

  

* You understand modern Linux cloud computing technologies, including networking, storage, containers and K8s
* You love developing and growing people and have a strong track record of doing it
* You are focused on success and the delivery of timely, high quality software
* You have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree
* You have strong written and verbal technical communication skills
* You have experience programming in C and/or Go.


 What we offer you
   

  

 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Employee Assistance Programme
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
* Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
   

  

 Canonical is an equal opportunity employer
   

  

 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Controller till museum
description:
**Konsultuppdrag för dig med erfarenhet från myndighet!**
****Om uppdraget****
 Vi söker dig som är en Controller och vill ha ett konsultuppdrag med start snarast möjligast till och med december 2025 med chans till förlängning. Uppdragets omfattning avser 100% av en heltid och kommer att utföras i kundens lokaler vid Norra Djurgården med möjlighet till distansarbete 1-2 dagar i veckan enligt överenskommelse. Under de första en till två månaderna behöver du vara på plats merparten av tiden.
   

  

 Du kommer att arbeta mot avdelningen för forskning och samlingar (FA) på museet, vid avdelningen finns 6 enheter varav det ingår att stödja såväl avdelningschefen som enhetscheferna.
   

  

****Dina arbetsuppgifter****
 Arbetet består huvudsakligen av budgetering, prognoser, intern uppföljning av utfall på anslag, bidrag och uppdrag samt ekonomisk rapportering av externfinansierad verksamhet, både till svenska myndigheter och till EU.
   

  

 Du kommer även arbeta med andra delar av enhetens ansvarsområde, som till
   

  

 exempel bokslutsarbete och projekt inom ekonomiområdet.
   

  

**Dina kvalifikationer**
* minst tre (3) års arbetslivserfarenhet som controller
* goda kunskaper i MS Office eller likvärdigt
* gymnasium eller likvärdig utbildning
* genomgått utbildning inom aktuellt område
* kunskaper i analysverktyg (exempelvis QlikView och Insikt)
* kunskaper i ekonomisystem (exempelvis U4 Agresso, Raindance, Visma m.fl.
* erfarenhet av statlig redovisning
* kunna kommunicera obehindrat på svenska och engelska, såväl i tal som skrift.
* kunna uppge erfarenhet från två likvärdiga uppdrag\*
* Referensuppdragen ska vara utförda hos en statlig myndighet och ha genomförts under de tre senaste åren (2021-2023). Med likvärdigt uppdrag menas uppdrag och projektfinansierad verksamhet med externa finansiärer (exempelvis andra myndigheter, EU och Vetenskapsrådet).


**Vad vi erbjuder dig**
 Som konsult på Bemannia erbjuder vi dig en nära kontakt med din konsultchef och en möjlighet till fler uppdrag via oss. Hos oss får du utvecklas på lärorika arbetsplatser och känna att din kompetens kommer till nytta.
   

  

**Om ansökan**
 Sök tjänsten genom att klicka på ansök nedan. Ladda gärna upp ditt cv i word-format och på svenska. Urval och intervjuer sker löpande och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas före sista ansökningsdag,
 **10 oktober.**
 Vi tar inte emot ansökningar via mail men har du specifika frågor kring tjänsten besvaras dessa av ansvarig rekryterare,
 **Kajsa Hessel kajsa.hessel@bemannia.se**
 För generella funderingar kring din ansökan eller vår rekryteringsprocess når du oss under kontorstid på
 **0765689477**
 Bemannia är ett publikt och svenskägt bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag som tillhandahåller kompetent och kvalificerad personal genom uthyrning, rekrytering och personalentreprenader inom Organisation & Ledarskap, PR & Information, Marknad & Sälj, Ekonomi, Juridik, HR & Personal, Fastighet & Teknik, IT & Data samt Kontor & Administration. Bemannia har ramavtal med merparten av Sveriges Myndigheter och Sveriges kommuner, dess förvaltningar och bolag. Bemannia är medlem i Kompetensföretagen och är ett auktoriserat Bemanningsföretag och Rekryteringsföretag samt har kollektivavtal med Unionen, Akademikerna, SEKO samt LO och Hotell- och Restauranganställdas förbund. Bemannia är certifierat enligt SS-EN ISO 9001:2015, Ledningssystem för kvalitet, SS-EN ISO 14001:2015, Miljöledningssystem – krav och vägledning, SS-ISO 45001:2018, Ledningssystem för arbetsmiljö och SS-ISO/IEC 27001:2013 Ledningssystem för informationssäkerhet
   

  

 Ledningen för bolaget har varit verksam i branschen i 40 år.

title: Director Data Science & Insights, Platform
description:
Platform Mission is responsible for Spotify’s tech infrastructure, including our cloud services, data ecosystem, and client infrastructure. This role will guide and oversee the Insights work across the Mission. The role includes driving the Mission level Insights Strategy, which explains, for example, the performance of our Tech ecosystem to Spotify Executives. It also includes working with individual leaders and their teams on specific aspects such as data storage or security.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

* Articulate and facilitate a clear metrics strategy for the Mission and Spotify’s tech leadership, covering a wide range of aspects, from cloud costs to engineering productivity.
* Be an assertive driver of metrics quality and form high-value insights informing Platform Missions investments and decision-making. Collaborate closely with individual leaders on key aspects of our insights strategy, such as the technical health of our ecosystem.
* Evaluate and provide step-changing improvements to improving data engineering for insights..Improve accuracy of data and trust in insights.
* Provide leadership, direction, and mentorship for a team of Insights practitioners, including Data Engineers, Data Analysts, and Data Scientists.
* Foster Spotify's values within your team while setting new standards in execution and insights excellence.
* Collaborate effectively with senior Insides leaders across Spotify to elevate the impact of Insights teams


 Who You Are
   

  

* You have extensive experience managing insights teams across complex business units.
* You have domain expertise in technical infrastructure and platform teams.
* You believe in actionable insights that enable executive decision-making. You can eloquently articulate deep technical implications visible in data, so it is easy to follow for a potentially nontechnical audience.
* You are an inspirational leader who fosters in and around your team passion for data and a commitment to insights excellence.
* You have a proven track record of influencing decision-making at all levels within an organization and in various contexts.


 Where You'll Be
   

  

* This role will ideally be located in Sweden or London. There is flexibility for potentially one of our other EMEA locations \*excluding Netherlands, Germany and France for now due to on call restrictions." with frequent collaboration with teams in London, Stockholm, New York and other European and US locations.
* Working hours? We operate within Central European and Eastern US time zones for collaboration and ask that all be located in that time zone.


 Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.
   

  

 Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.

title: Warehouse Management System (WMS) Project Manager
description:
We are looking for an expert in Warehouse Management Systems to manage implementation projects on various Contract Logistics sites in Sweden.
   

  

**Your Role**
 In this role, you are part of a team of six people, reporting to the National Contract Logistics Information Systems Manager. You lead projects to implement information systems, mainly Warehouse Management Systems on all our Contract Logistics sites, in Norrköping, Eskilstuna, Gothenburg, Malmö and Kista. You manage cross-functional project teams, and work together with our customers, ensuring a seamless transition to a new information systems environment, well-adjusted to the processes of each warehouse operation.
   

  

**Your Responsibilities**
* WMS implementation project management
* Manage projects effectively, ensuring timely and budget-friendly delivery with cross-functional teams
* Solution design, system and integration setup, documentation
* System testing and customer solution verification
* Integration with warehouse automation solutions
* Go live planning and support
* Continuous learning and improvement


**Your Skills And Experiences**
* Experience in working with, supporting and implementing a WMS, familiarity with SwiftLOG or Blue Yonder is a plus
* Degree in engineering with solid interest in IT and supply chain business processes
* Comprehensive understanding of operations and applications within logistics and supply chain
* Fluent in English, Swedish is a big plus
* Distinct analytical thinking and robust problem solving skills
* Has excellent communication skills, a positive working attitude and is a team player
* Keeps calm and solution oriented also when under pressure
* Possibility and willingness to travel within Sweden (and regularly commute to one of our sites mentioned above) -KP1


**Good Reasons to Join**
 You will join a global and market-leading logistics company, where you have the opportunity to impact the business by delivering best-in-class solutions. At Kuehne+Nagel, we offer the opportunity for professional and personal development, where you can grow your expertise, shape processes and create and apply innovative solutions.

title: Upphandlare med kategoriledaransvar, Serviceförvaltningen
description:
*Vi söker dig, vår nya upphandlare med kategoriledaransvar som vill möjliggöra för oss att växa och lyckas i vårt gemensamma uppdrag att försörja Region Stockholm med varor och tjänster inom IT-området. Tycker du som vi att det är viktigt att det du gör på dagarna bidrar till något positivt. Då kan vi och serviceförvaltning vara rätt för dig!*
 Om tjänsten
   

  

 Som upphandlare hos oss kommer du att spela en nyckelroll i hela upphandlingsprocessen - från behovsanalys till genomförande och implementering. Vårt team hanterar ett brett spektrum av varor och tjänster, och ditt fokusområde kommer att vara IT system och IT relaterade tjänster. Du ansvarar självständigt för att planera och genomföra upphandlingar, där arbetet innefattar både regiongemensamma upphandlingar med många kontaktytor och intressenter samt lokala upphandlingar till specifik beställare.
   

  

 Du kommer att agera projektledare för dina egna upphandlingar och jobba nära sakkunniga för att säkerställa kvalité i varje upphandling och du kommer att hantera flera parallella upphandlingsprocesser samtidigt. Avdelningen där du kommer att vara placerad erbjuder också en rådgivande funktion för frågor som rör upphandlingar inom organisationen och du kommer att vara expert för frågor som rör IT-upphandling. Tjänsten kräver ett öga för detaljer och förmågan att samordna komplexa flöden och många kontaktytor. Vidare är det viktigt att kunna fånga och sammanställa mångas viljor samt att kunna driva arbetet framåt på ett pragmatiskt sätt.
   

  

 Vårt gemensamma mål är att kunna leverera upphandlingar av högsta kvalitet som bidrar till att förbättra verksamheten och skapar effektivitet för alla användare inom organisationen.
   

  

 Vem är du?
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har mycket god analytisk förmåga, ett gott omdöme och integritet. Du har lätt för att anpassa dig till ändrade omständigheter och kan växla mellan strategiskt och operativt arbete.
   

  

 Du är strukturerad och kan planera, organisera och prioritera arbetet på ett effektivt sätt. Du gillar att projektleda stora upphandlingar med många intressenter och kan navigera mellan att ta egna beslut, rådfråga styrgrupper och expertgrupper och eskalera frågeställningar vid behov. Vidare tar du initiativ, sätter igång aktiviteter och uppnår resultat. Därtill är du affärsmässig och bra på att skapa goda och hållbara relationer samt har lätt för att skapa samarbete med andra. För oss är det även viktigt att du delar våra värderingar om:
 *Öppenhet, Kompetens, Pålitlighet* 
 och
 *Samverkan.*
 För att bli framgångsrik i rollen ser vi att du har:
   

  

 Krav
   

  

* Akademisk examen inom juridik, ekonomi, inköp, upphandling eller för tjänsten annan relevant inriktning.
* Gedigen kunskap om Lagen om Offentlig Upphandling (LOU).
* Erfarenhet av att upphandla/producera IT-avtal och dess bilagor.
* Ha god förståelse för IT-system.
* Praktisk erfarenhet av att leda komplexa IT-upphandlingar med stora expert/referens-grupper och flera beställare.
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av strategiskt upphandlingsarbete samt erfarenhet av arbete med upphandlingsverktyg.
* Dokumenterad kompetens och erfarenhet av att leda och genomföra IT-upphandlingar.
* Mycket God kunskap i svenska i såväl skrift som tal.
* Skicklig användare av informations tekniska hjälpmedel.


 Meriterande
   

  

* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i en större organisation med flera beställare.
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet och kunskap inom IT-branschen.
* Bevisad ledarskapserfarenhet med förmåga att leda team och projekt mot framgång.
* Gedigen projektledningskompetens, både teoretisk och praktisk, med fokus på att driva komplexa projekt
* Mångårig erfarenhet från offentligt sektor eller annan komplex organisation, med djup förståelse för de särskilda krav och processer som gäller inom offentlig förvaltning.


 Självklart har du ett intresse för vår verksamhet och för innehållet i tjänsten.
   

  

 Vårt erbjudande
   

  

 Vi har kollektivavtal och med det följer kollektivavtalade försäkringar, tjänstepension och möjlighet till löneväxling. För att du ska kunna ta ansvar för din hälsa erbjuder vi friskvårdstimme och friskvårdsbidrag samt subventionerad sjukvård i form av kostnadsfri öppensjukvård. Flexibel arbetstid och möjlighet till att arbeta hemifrån har vi för att underlätta för dig att få ihop vardagen. Här kan du läsa mer om förmånerna i vårt kollektivavtal.
   

  

 Ansökan
   

  

 Låter det här som något för dig ser vi gärna att du söker så snart som möjligt. För en komplett ansökan ska du bifoga ditt CV och personliga brev. När du ansöker kommer du att få besvara ett antal frågor.
   

  

 Har du frågor är du välkommen att kontakta Cecilia Drott, Enhetschef Övergripande material och
   

  

 tjänster, Upphandling. Epost: cecilia.drott@regionstockholm.se.
   

  

 Serviceförvaltningen – en nyckelspelare! Serviceförvaltningen levererar kvalitativa och konkurrenskraftiga tjänster inom IT, upphandling, ekonomi, HR, facility management och kommunikation till förvaltningar och bolag inom Region Stockholm. Det gör oss till en nyckelspelare i arbetet med att skapa mervärde för verksamheterna som ansvarar för regionens hälso- och sjukvård, kollektivtrafik, regionala utveckling och kultur. Vill du arbeta i en organisation där din insats gör stor skillnad och där du får både utveckla och utvecklas? Då är serviceförvaltningen rätt för dig. Läs mer här
   

  

 Att söka jobb i Region Stockholm Vi eftersträvar jämställdhet och jämlikhet på vår arbetsplats och ser gärna sökande med olika bakgrund och förutsättningar. Vi tar endast emot ansökningar via detta system. Ansök genom att klicka på knappen ”Ansök”. Ansökningar per brev eller e-post beaktas inte. Vi undanber oss direktkontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt säljare av ytterligare jobbannonser. Vårt rekryteringssystem kan inte hantera anonyma ansökningar eller sökande med skyddade personuppgifter. Om du har skyddade personuppgifter ber vi dig att kontakta den kontaktpersonen som finns angiven i annonsen. Din ansökan kommer då att hanteras utanför rekryteringssystemet. Du bör även vara försiktig med vilken information du lämnar i din ansökan och endast ta med information som är relevant för den aktuella befattningen. Region Stockholm ansvarar för hälso- och sjukvård, kollektivtrafik, regional utveckling och bidrar till kulturlivet. Varje dag, dygnet runt. I landets snabbaste växande region. Tillsammans skapar vi Europas attraktivaste storstadsregion. Läs mer om hur det är att jobba hos oss i Region Stockholm
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Stockholm | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2024/5263 | Kontakt: Cecilia Drott cecilia.drott@regionstockholm.se, | Facklig företrädare: Mona Ternelius, SACO 08-12317830, Anne-Lie Vestlund, Vision 08-12314280, | Publicerat: 2024-09-27 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2024-10-18

title: Senior Business Controller
description:
*Vi söker efter en Senior Business Controller som vill utvecklas tillsammans med oss! Är du vår nya kollega?* 




  





**Om Iver** 




 Iver är en ledande nordisk helhetsleverantör av affärskritiska IT-tjänster och plattformar. Våra tjänster är kritiska inte bara för våra kunder – utan för digitaliseringen av samhället i stort. Med spetskompetens inom IT-infrastruktur, cybersäkerhet, data och moln säkerställer vi att sjukvården har tillgång till rätt patientdata, att samhällskritiska system aldrig ligger nere och att flygplanen landar säkert. Som en lyhörd och affärsnära helhetspartner möjliggör vi våra kunders innovation – idag och imorgon. Iver har cirka 1 500 medarbetare på 25 kontor i Sverige och Norge, och omsätter drygt 3 miljarder SEK
 



  





**Om Tjänsten** 




 Du kommer att vara en del av vårt Group Business Controll-team som utgörs av en diversifierad grupp av medarbetare som leds av Head of FP&A. Detta är en analytisk och affärsnära roll där du tillsammans med teamet kommer att ansvara för flera affärsområden och samarbeta med såväl affärsledningsgrupperna och företagsledningen. I rollen kommer du att agera Business Partner och vara en rådgivande part kopplat till insikter och beslut som ska fattas. Du har möjlighet att tillsammans med Head of FP&A utforma rollen.
 



  





**Arbetsuppgifter** 



* Utveckla, implementera och underhålla finansiella modeller och prognosverktyg för att stödja datadrivna affärsbeslut.
* Självständigt leda och koordinera arbetsströmmar inom utvecklingsprojekt
* Analysera finansiell data och identifiera trender, risker och möjligheter.
* Samarbeta med olika avdelningar för att säkerställa korrekt och relevant finansiell rapportering, samt identifiera utvecklingsområden.
* Stödja ledningen med strategisk planering och beslutsfattande genom att tillhandahålla insiktsfulla finansiella analyser och rekommendationer.
* Stötta affärsområden och ledningsgrupp med löpande rapportering och ad-hoc analyser.
* Delta i utvecklingen av nyckeltal, rapportering och affärssystem, exempelvis via Power BI.



  





**Vad erbjuder vi dig på Iver?** 




**Iver - Where business meets technology!** 
 Hos Iver får du möjlighet att arbeta med den senaste tekniken och vara med på en spännande tillväxtresa. Iver är ett bolag med entreprenöriella rötter och en kultur som präglas av flexibilitet och samarbete. Vårt mål är att våra kunder – här i Norden och internationellt – ska se oss som en ledande partner för digital transformation. På Iver är vi inkluderande och strävar efter genuint samarbete där vi arbetar mot gemensamma mål. Inom Iver finns stora möjligheter till utveckling och vi står bakom dig när du vill lära dig mer – inom ditt specialområde, ledarskap eller nya områden. Hos Iver är du också en del av ett ambitiöst och innovativt företag, vilket innebär att förbättra, testa, utvärdera och våga ändra hur vi gör saker är viktiga ingredienser och vi är övertygade om att det är så vi utvecklas.
 **We’re** 
 not big blue. We’re yellow. Stora nog att skala och agila nog att innovera.
 



  





**Din bakgrund och profil** 




 För att passa i rollen ser vi att du har en bakgrund inom Transaction Services (Financial Due Diligence, Commercial Due Diligence, Corporate Finance eller Valuation). Du trivs i en föränderlig miljö och kan arbeta självständigt med stöd från Head of F&A. Du är en proaktiv problemlösare med starka analytiska färdigheter, som inte bara kan identifiera trender och risker utan också omvandla dessa insikter till strategiska rekommendationer. Som Business Controller i vårt team kommer du att spela en nyckelroll i att driva och stödja finansiella projekt och beslut. Du är självgående och bekväm med att ta initiativ, och du har förmågan att kommunicera komplex finansiell information på ett lättförståeligt sätt till olika intressenter. Vi värdesätter din förmåga att samarbeta tvärfunktionellt och ditt driv att utvecklas tillsammans med Iver.
 



  





**Vi ser att du har** 



* Självgående och proaktiv med förmåga att driva projekt och leverera resultat inom utsatta tidsramar.
* Civilekonomexamen eller motsvarande.
* Starka analytiska färdigheter och förmåga att hantera stora datamängder.
* Utmärkta kunskaper i Excel.
* Erfarenhet av Power-BI är en fördel men inget krav
* Meriterande med erfarenhet av Transaction Services (FDD, CDD, Valuation, Corporate finance).
* God kommunikativ förmåga och vana att presentera komplexa finansiella data på ett begripligt sätt.
* Flytande i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.



  





**Placeringsort** 




 Vi finns på 26 kontor runt om i Sverige. Placeringsort för denna roll är på ett av våra kontor.
 



  





**Sök till oss!** 




  





 Urval sker löpande, tjänsten kan tillsättas före sista ansökningsdag. Iver eftersträvar en jämn könsfördelning och värdesätter etnisk och kulturell mångfald. Önskad start är snarast eller enligt överenskommelse. Sista ansökningsdag: 2024-09-15
 



 Du är välkommen att kontakta Olof Ahlberg (Olof.Ahlberg@iver.se) eller Andreas Nilsson (andreas.nilsson@iver.se) vid frågor eller funderingar kring tjänsten. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
 



  





**Välkommen till Iver!**

title: Marketing Manager
description:
**About us: Introducing Centra**
 Centra is the only commerce platform built specifically for fashion and lifestyle brands. With Centra, brands can run their global Direct-to-Consumer and Digital Wholesale operations. Centra has a market leading position in the Nordic’s, and we’re growing fast across the rest of Europe. We’re now looking to accelerate the global expansion and become the market leader in several other countries.We’ve built our software to be the very best in the world and we build our team around that same idea. While we are still a young company we already work with some of the strongest brands in the Nordics and have clients throughout Europe, North America, and Asia.
   

  

**We are recruiting a Marketing Manager**
 We’re looking for a Marketing Manager with a proven track record of implementing a B2B marketing strategy to drive lead generation. In this role, you’ll collaborate with most teams across the business and be the driving force behind many of our marketing campaigns. You’ll effectively communicate our value proposition through events, social media, email and more. Join us in shaping the future of our marketing efforts and making a meaningful impact on our growth trajectory.
   

  

**Role Responsibilities**
 This role is a fantastic opportunity to make your mark and here’s what you’ll be doing:
   

  

* Campaign ideation: work closely with the rest of the marketing team, sales and partnerships to craft campaigns throughout the marketing funnel to drive and convert leads
* Campaign management: project manage multiple campaigns end to end and bringing in relevant stakeholders when needed
* Email marketing: work closely with the creative team to send regular email newsletters and really hone our automated campaigns
* Social media: own the Centra social channels, work closely with the creative team to ideate fresh new posts across Linkedin and Instagram
* Content: work with our content writer to launch new blog posts, case studies, guides and ebooks
* Events: help with the organisation and project management of events across our key markets, everything from trade shows to intimate dinners
* Webinars: help with the launch and growth of a new webinar series
* Sales and partner enablement: where needed, help the sales and partner teams with any marketing materials. Communicate with them regularly on any new campaigns we have launching.
* Partner marketing: amplify Centras marketing messaging through working closely with our agency and technology partners. Work closely with the partnership team to find new opportunities for collaboration.
* Agency / Freelancer collaboration: assist in the management and collaboration of any external agencies or freelancers.


**Essential**
**Role requirements:**
* 3+ years experience in B2B marketing at either a SaaS company or agency
* Based in London or Stockholm
* Great English communication and writing skills
* High level of drive and self-motivation
* Strong project management skills
* Previous experience working cross functionally between teams


**Bonus Points If**
* You have experience in the ecommerce ecosystem
* You can write short to medium form content (social, emails and shorter blog posts)
* You have Hubspot experience
* You’ve worked at a scale-up before
* You can speak another language
* You’re passionate about fashion


**What You Can Expect From Us**
 Unique product
   

  

* Headless e-commerce platform for fashion & lifestyle brands
* A portfolio of clients from some of the most renowned fashion brands in Europe
* Fully funded scale-up, post series A


 Social benefits
   

  

* Attractive salary based on your skills, experience, and potential
* The opportunity to join a fast-growing B2B SaaS scale-up
* The opportunity to work with strong international brands on innovative projects
* Personal development and growth programs
* A strong entrepreneurial and tech-savvy team culture, with a lot of laughs
* Support from experienced and helpful co-workers
* Central office locations in Stockholm, London and Wroclaw and flexibility around remote work


 Self-development
   

  

* A non-hierarchical work environment where you’ll have a lot of impact and space for growth
* A budget for participating in educational programs, meet-ups, and other events related to your profession


 Feel at home
   

  

* Casual dress code. Wear whatever makes you feel good, but we love fashion.
* At Centra, we believe that you should always feel welcome. No matter who you are, we are committed to fostering an inclusive environment for all colleagues


 Follow us at @lifeatcentra on Instagram, to see what it's like to work at Centra and meet some Centra teammates.

title: Senior Principal Product Analyst | Candy Crush Saga
description:
**Craft:**
 Data, Analytics & Strategy
   

  

**Job Description:**
 We are looking for a talented Senior Principal Product Analyst to push and deeply understand the performance of our game economy as part of the Candy Crush Saga team. You will get the opportunity to be part of a great team, working with an industry leading and genre defining game with over 200 million active players.
   

  

 Your Role Within the Kingdom
   

  

 As the Senior Principal Product Analyst, you are tasked with leading the charge in holistically understanding, analysing, and optimising our game economy. You will work cross-functionally with Product Managers, Game Economy/System Designers and Engineers to not only analyse current economic systems, but also innovate and guide implementation of solutions that boost player engagement. Your deep understanding of economy dynamics and analytics will be pivotal in crafting strategic insights that propel Candy Crush Saga to new heights.
   

  

 This role is crucial for driving the analytical foundation of our game economy work, including strategy, experimentation cycles and delivery of actionable insights to have a positive impact on our understanding, decision-making, and ultimately our player satisfaction.
   

  

 Key responsibilities:
   

  

* Opportunity identification
+ Support the product area and growth via evaluation, performance reporting and data driven recommendations, including data and tech project coordination.
+ Identify data-driven opportunities for your team, fostering value creation and problem-solving without predefined solutions.

* High quality analytics
+ Use knowledge about existing tools, methodologies and insights to both deepen analytical understanding and apply these to different problems.
+ Provide strategic actions based on insights from your expertise in business, industry trends and competitor landscape; drive business observability.

* Managing workflow
+ Create and coordinate work smartly to deliver value continuously and mitigate risk independently.
+ Guide stakeholders and the data community in improving ways of working, support tools and processes, collaborating cross-functionally to guarantee value delivery.

* Communication
+ Clearly communicate the findings of your analysis to colleagues, enabling them to utilize the insights for learning or decision-making. Clearly and concisely report results and progress, ensuring conclusions are drawn from transparently cited sources.
+ Foster strong relationships with other key functions across the business


 Skills to Create Thrills
   

  

* Comprehensive understanding of the dynamics of fast-paced economic systems, focusing on analysis and optimization. Ability to dissect complex economies to drive data-driven narratives and strategic decisions.
* Expertise in handling analytically complex projects, from concept to execution.
* Consistent track record as a key partner in cross-functional teams dedicated to developing economic systems or similar projects.
* Highly proficient in SQL as well as sufficient skills in Python or R for numerical analysis.
* Prior experience working directly with other peers in data science, engineering, consumer research, and business intelligence.
* Masters’ or PhD Degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Physics, Economics, Engineering or similar field or work experience.


 We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.
   

  

**About King**
 At King, we're Making the World Playful. Heard of Candy Crush? We're the creators behind it. With game studios in Stockholm, Malmö, London, Barcelona and Berlin, and offices in Dublin, San Francisco, New York, and Malta, we have a 20-year history of delivering some of the world's most iconic games in the mobile gaming industry and are on a mission to level-up the little moments for our more than 200 million active monthly users. But we aren't just crushing it with candies, we're also behind Farm Heroes, Bubble Witch, Pet Rescue and loads of other sweet games. As a leading interactive entertainment company for the mobile world, King is part of Activision Blizzard, which was acquired by Microsoft.
   

  

**A Great Saga Needs All Sorts of Heroes**
 King strives to be a place where everyone can be their most authentic self. We recognize that diversity, equity and inclusion is a vital and continuous conversation, and that change only happens when we all come together. It’s our mission to build a diverse and inclusive Kingdom for our people, players, and community.
   

  

**Making the World Playful**
 Making the World Playful is our mission – it’s the thread that connects our people, our players, and our passion for our games. Let’s face it, who doesn’t love a bit of fun?
   

  

 Kingsters are seriously playful: creative thinkers who balance art and science to bring moments of magic to millions daily. But our players aren’t the only ones that can level-up. We’re always looking for ways to champion each other and make what’s already great, even better.
   

  

 So, if this feels like a fun way to spend your days, and you share our passion, our values, and our hunger to shape the future, join us in Making the World Playful.
   

  

 Applications need to be in English.
   

  

 Discover King at careers.king.com

title: Jurist
description:
**Du jurist - vill du jobba i en annorlunda och spännande bransch?**
 Vi som söker dig är Södertörns brandförsvarsförbund, ett kommunalförbund som sköter räddningstjänst enligt LSO (2003:778) i kommunerna Botkyrka, Ekerö, Haninge, Huddinge, Nacka, Nykvarn, Nynäshamn, Salem, Södertälje och Tyresö. Vårt uppdrag är att bidra till att våra 630 000 kommuninvånare känner sig trygga och säkra i sin kommun.
   

  

 Du kommer att arbeta med ärenden som rör avtalsrätt, kommunalrätt, förvaltningsrätt, offentlighet och sekretess, säkerhetsskydd och dataskyddsförordningen. Du kommer att hålla interna utbildningar för vår personal.
   

  

 I tjänsten ingår att företräda förbundet i domstol. De flesta ärenden gäller överklagan till förvaltningsdomstol av myndighetsutövning.
   

  

 Vårt huvudkontor finns på station Lindvreten, Huddinge kommun.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
 Vi söker dig med juristexamen. För att lyckas i uppdraget behöver du ha allmänjuridisk kompetens och vilja att lära dig speciallagstiftning. Som person är du självgående, lösningsfokuserad och öppen för nya arbetssätt. Du arbetar effektivt, både enskilt och i nära samarbete med andra, sätter verksamhetens behov i fokus och har förmåga att prioritera. Du är ansvarsfull och strukturerad med hög integritet.
   

  

 Tjänsten kräver mycket god förmåga att utrycka sig i både tal och skrift på svenska och god förmåga på engelska.
   

  

**Vad vi gärna ser hos dig**
 Uppdraget innebär att både driva och utveckla funktionens roll samt stödja och konsultera både handläggare, chefer och förtroendevalda. Det är därför viktigt att du har god samarbetsförmåga, hög flexibilitet och servicekänsla. Du behöver ha förmåga att uttrycka och förmedla lösningar i både enklare och mer komplexa frågeställningar på ett enkelt och lättbegripligt sätt.
   

  

 Då rollen som förbundsjurist innebär att du är den i vår organisation som är bäst på juridik ser vi att du kontinuerligt underhåller din specialistkunskap och själv tar ansvar för att upprätthålla en hög nivå i ditt arbete. Det finns även ett flertal juristnätverk där vi önskar att du deltar.
   

  

 Vår nuvarande jurist går i pension nästa år och kommer att vara tillgänglig så att du ska kunna komma in i arbetet på ett bra sätt och lära känna vår organisation.
   

  

**Varför Södertörns brandförsvarsförbund?**
 Vi har ett samhällsansvar som vi gillar och är stolta över. Vi tar vårt uppdrag ett steg längre och gör alltid lite mer än vad som förväntas av oss. Vi strävar alltid för att göra vårt bästa och med glädje delar vi med oss av vår kunskap. Vi arbetar alltid utifrån att de vi möter, verkar för och samarbetar med ska uppleva den bästa, tryggaste och säkraste servicen i en miljö som präglas av tillit.
   

  

 Vi arbetar aktivt för att vara en arbetsplats som är fri från diskriminering och som ger lika möjligheter för alla. Vi strävar efter en arbetsplats där olikheter tas tillvara och allas lika värde är självklart. En jämställd arbetsplats fri från kränkningar är en rättighet.
   

  

**Övrigt**
 Befattningen innebär tillsvidareanställning som inleds med provanställning. Tillträde enligt överenskommelse. Arbetsplatsen ligger på station Lindvreten, Mogårdsvägen 2 i Vårby.
   

  

 För denna tjänst kommer även en säkerhetsklassning genomföras och svenskt medborgarskap är ett krav.
   

  

 Din ansökan med CV vill vi ha senast 2024-10-20
   

  

 Vi tar emot ansökningar direkt från kandidater och undanber oss därför vänligen kontakt från rekryteringsföretag eller liknande tjänster.
   

  

**Frågor**
 För mer information om tjänsten, kontakta Susanne Nilsson, chef Admin/IT, susanne.nilsson@sbff.se
   

  

 Fackliga företrädare är Kommunal,  jennifer.neilson@sbff.se, Ledarna, anna.aberg@sbff.se och Sveriges Ingenjörer, christian.dahl@sbff.se
