title: Sr. Infrastructure Engineer (DevOps)
description:
Meet 
 
 Yubico
 
 : the inventor of the 
 
 YubiKey
 
 ––the world's first and leading security key. Our company’s mission is to make secure login easy and available for everyone. Yubico was founded in 2007 by Stina and Jakob Ehrensvard, and recently went public on Nasdaq First North Growth Market Stockholm: YUBICO. Our customers include Fortune 500 companies, hundreds of government agencies and millions of individuals in over 160 countries that rely on Yubico technology to secure access to computers, online services and mobile apps. We  are a global company with a strong company culture and employees located in over 14 countries. Yubico’s  headquarters are based in  Stockholm, Sweden and Santa Clara, CA.  Aligned with our mission to make the internet more secure for everyone, Yubico donates YubiKeys to organizations helping at-risk individuals through our philanthropic initiative, 
 
 Secure it Forward
 
 .
 








**At Yubico, we offer:** 








**Yubico Values:** 
 We work to ensure that our employees have an open space to have their voices amplified to create a diverse, equitable, and inclusive workplace where everyone feels like they belong. Aligned with this, our employees have created some pretty cool Employee Resource Groups: YubiPride, YubiBIPOC, YubiSustainability and YubiWomen. Additionally, Yubico donates YubiKeys to organizations in need all over the world (you can read more about our work here).
 







**Social Connection:** 
 Relationships and connectedness matter, and we love spending time with our team! Our virtual workspace keeps us connected day-to-day whether it's through Yubico celebrating wins or our buzzing Slack communities. We host an all-team event in a new location every year where we plan for upcoming quarters, set goals, and most importantly, host fun events to encourage team building outside of the workplace. Check out our Life at Yubico Page on LinkedIn and our awards here
 **.** 




  





**The Role:** 









 Be part of the team that maintains the company infrastructure and enables the next generation of security services. Working with a cross-global team in Sweden and the US, our goal is to automate everything from CI/CD pipelines to DNS records. If you are looking for a fun challenge, are passionate about usable security, and want to work at a fast-moving company, this opportunity is for you! 
 









 Reporting to the Infrastructure Manager, you will help design and manage infrastructure built as a service to replace manual workloads and processes. This role will be a hybrid work model.
 





  




**Tasks & Responsibilities:** 
* Ensuring the security, availability, performance, scalability, and automation of our infrastructure
* Ensuring reliable and ongoing measurement and monitoring of our infrastructure
* Maintaining and enhancing build/deployment pipelines for continuous integration and continuous delivery of changes to improve the quality and availability of our products
* Establishing new technologies in a broad spectrum, often influencing company-wide infrastructure decisions
* Establishing feedback loops for continuous improvement by collecting and analyzing data from engineering and operations processes
* Help automate and develop tools that ensure the rapid, safe, and high-quality delivery of features
* Partnering with teams including members from engineering, operations, and other relevant areas
* Providing training and support to team members to enhance their understanding of DevOps practices
* Promoting a culture of continuous improvement by identifying areas of enhancement and implementing iterative changes
* Work closely with the cyber security team to ensure compliance with the company's security and privacy policies
* Keep up to date on latest technology and best practices, continuously improve and challenge yourself
* Develop and maintain technical documentation, including knowledge base articles and best practices
* Support on-prem servers
* Other system administration tasks as needed



  




**Skills & Experience:** 
* 10+ years supporting an infrastructure/networking eco-system
* 5+ years of working with one public cloud, GCP, AWS, and/or Azure. Focus will be GCP, experience supporting GCP environments
* 5+ years of working with DevOps, Automation and/or Software development lifecycle
* 5+ years of experience working IaC (Infrastructure as Code) tools like Terraform
* 5+ years of experience working with configuration management tools like Ansible
* 5+ years of experience working with a CI/CD tool set (e.g., GitHub, GitHub Actions, SonarQube code coverage tool, Code vulnerability scanning tools like Veracode)
* 5+ years of experience in provisioning and maintaining Azure or GCP PaaS components, like SQL DB, MongoDB, Storage Accounts/Buckets, Secret Management tools
* Strong experience with containerization technologies (Docker, Kubernetes)
* Specialized knowledge of proactive solutions to prevent future problems and automate processes so that engineers can self-service their operational requirements
* Strong Linux administration skills (Ubuntu, CentOS etc.)
* Experience and knowledge of software packages and dependencies
* Strong experience in bash and python
* Experience supporting on-prem servers (Linux)






  




  














  





 We are an equal opportunity employer, we value diversity and uphold an inclusive environment where all people feel that they are equally respected and valued. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, marital status, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law. We'd love to learn about what you can add to our diverse team.
 







 Yubico does not accept agency resumes or referrals so please do not send them to our careers staff or employees. Yubico is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes or referrals.
 







 Personal data submitted through this form is used for managing Yubico’s recruitment activities, which include facilitating any application you make, setting up and conducting interviews and tests for applicants, evaluating and assessing results and selecting candidates, and as otherwise needed in our recruitment and onboarding processes. The use of your personal data may also be necessary prior to entering into a contract with you (that is prior to offering you a job with Yubico). Your personal data will only be used for the purposes for which it was collected and in accordance with the Yubico Privacy Notice. We only keep your personal data for as long as necessary and in compliance with Yubico’s record retention policies. If you have asked us to, we will keep you informed of other opportunities at Yubico. We do this in various ways, including email and by phone. If at any time you do not want us to contact you or use your information as described herein please contact us at jobs@yubico.com to let us know and we will delete all such information. Providing your personal data is voluntary, but necessary to join our talent community, and if you do not agree to provide your data, we will not be able to consider you as part of our talent community.
 







 As part of providing the requested service, we will transfer your data to be processed by Lever, Inc., a service provider contracted by Yubico AB and/or its subsidiaries that meets legally mandated privacy requirements. The Yubico Privacy Notice offers more information about Yubico privacy practices, including the lawful basis for processing of personal data, how to lodge a complaint with the supervisory authority, and how to contact Yubico to exercise your data subject rights. In this notice, when we refer to "Yubico", "us", "we" or "our", we mean the Yubico group company or companies that you apply to, or correspond with, and which are responsible for any personal data collected about you.

title: DevSecOps Engineer till Tyréns
description:
Nu har du möjlighet att axla en nyckelroll som DevSecOps Engineer och forma, bygga och säkra morgondagens IT-infrastruktur hos ett bolag där framtiden spelar roll.
   

  

 Tyréns är ett av Sveriges ledande konsultföretag inom samhällsbyggnad. Med 3 000 medarbetare, inklusive tusentals specialister inom stadsutveckling, arkitektur och infrastruktur, bygger de hållbara och innovativa samhällen. Var med och rita morgondagens karta och anta tekniska utmaningar, bidra med innovation och utvecklas längsmed vägen framåt.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Som DevSecOps Engineer hos Tyréns får du en central roll i IT-organisationen, där du arbetar nära såväl utvecklings- som driftsteamen för att optimera och säkra Tyréns infrastruktur. Du kommer att bidra till både strategisk och operativ utveckling inom IT, där du driver automatisering, felsökning och säkerhetsintegration men också vidareutvecklar processer och rutiner.
   

  

 Huvuduppgifter arbetsuppgifter:
   

  

* Förena utvecklings- och driftsprocesser för att skapa en smidig och effektiv miljö
* Integrera säkerhetslösningar i samarbete med utvecklingsteamen
* Felsöka och åtgärda säkerhetsrisker, samt proaktivt arbeta med riskhantering och incidenthantering.
* Automatisera processer för att optimera systemutveckling och drift
* Övervaka och analysera loggar samt systemprestanda för att säkerställa stabilitet och säkerhet.
* Driftsätta och konfigurera hård- och mjukvara på server och klientnivå


 Du blir en del ett sammansvetsat och erfaret team som jobbar med allt från avancerad nätverksinfrastruktur till support. Du kommer ha alla möjligheter att forma och påverka såväl innehåll i rollen som vidareutvecklingen av Tyréns IT-landskap, arbetssätt och processer.
   

  

 Möjliga placeringsorter är Stockholm eller Malmö. Tyréns tillämpar en hybrid arbetsmodell där du delvis kan arbeta på distans.
   

  

**Är det här du?**
 Vi söker dig som har en god förmåga att utmana nuläget och som är lösningsorienterad och självgående. Du tar egna initiativ för att utveckla både dig själv och organisationen. Du är duktig på att skapa samarbete med personer på olika nivåer och är hjälpsam, prestigelös och lyhörd.
   

  

 Du har:
   

  

* Erfarenhet av scriptspråk som exempelvis Python, Powershell och/eller Bash
* Erfarenhet av databasadministration, främst inom MS SQL
* Goda kunskaper inom systemutvecklingsområdet
* Erfarenhet av IT-infrastruktur i större organisationer
* Erfarenhet av serverdrift i Linux och Windows
* Goda kunskaper inom Microsoft Entra, Azure, MS365
* Goda kunskaper inom IT-säkerhet
* Erfarenhet av DevOps (metodik, verktyg, processer)


 Meriterande är om du har erfarenhet av administration av databaser, systemkonfiguration och certifieringar inom IT-området. Det är även meriterande om du har erfarenhet av AWS och/eller GCP.
   

  

 Det krävs att du har mycket goda kunskaper, skriftliga såväl som muntliga, i både svenska och engelska.
   

  

**Intresserad av att ansöka eller få veta mer?**
 I denna rekrytering samarbetar Tyréns med IDG Recruitment. Vid intresse eller frågor kontakta Alexandra Tihinen, Rekryteringskonsult, på alexandra.tihinen@foundryco.com alternativt 070-447 92 24.
   

  

 För att ansöka, vänligen skicka in ditt CV eller ansök med Linkedin.
   

  

**Om Tyréns**
*Tyréns är ett av Sveriges ledande konsultföretag inom samhällsbyggnad. I samspel med kunder och partners skapar vi hållbara lösningar inom stadsutveckling och infrastruktur. Vi har 3 000 medarbetare och verksamhet i Sverige, England, Estland, Litauen, Polen och Bulgarien. Tyréns är stiftelseägt och vår ägandeform gör det möjligt för oss att satsa målmedvetet på forskning och utveckling inom samhällsbyggnadsområdet. Vi drivs av nyfikenhet och har ett nära samarbete med universitet och högskolor.*

title: Devops Engineer
description:
The Wise Seeker is the leading HR technology company in unbiased talent evaluation.
   

  

 With over 15 years in the industry analyzing the needs and demands of the job market, we are capable of identifying the best talent for each company thanks to our team of professionals and our SaaS platform integrated with Artificial Intelligence.
   

  

 We are efficient, evaluate talent objectively without bias, and close hiring times in record time, delivering optimal results.
   

  

 Job Description:
   

  

 We are seeking a DevOps engineer for a short-term consultancy assignment.
   

  

 The primary responsibility is to lead the migration of data and repositories from Azure and GitLab to GitHub. The ideal candidate will have proven experience with version control systems, cloud platforms, and data migration strategies. Familiarity with iOS DevOps processes, including continuous integration and delivery pipelines for mobile apps, is desirable and will be considered an advantage.
   

  

 Key Responsibilities:
   

  

 Lead the migration of repositories and data from Azure and GitLab to GitHub, ensuring data integrity and minimal downtime.
   

  

 Develop and implement migration strategies, workflows, and best practices.
   

  

 Collaborate with development teams to ensure seamless integration of the new version control system.
   

  

 Optimize existing CI/CD pipelines for mobile applications, particularly within iOS development environments.
   

  

 Provide documentation and training to the team on new processes and tools.
   

  

 Troubleshoot and resolve issues that arise during the migration process.
   

  

 Requirements:
   

  

 Proven experience as a DevOps Engineer or similar role, with a focus on version control systems and cloud platforms.
   

  

 Strong expertise in Git, Azure, GitLab, and GitHub.
   

  

 Experience with data migration strategies and tools.
   

  

 Familiarity with iOS DevOps processes, including continuous integration and delivery for mobile apps.
   

  

 Proficient in scripting and automation tools (e.g., Bash, Python, or similar).
   

  

 Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently.
   

  

 Strong communication skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.
   

  

 English only is sufficient language skill for this assignment.

title: DevOps Engineer / Cloud Specialist
description:
*Vi söker nu en erfaren och driven DevOps Engineer till vårt nya team med ansvar för Länsförsäkringars gemensamma ”Cloud Data & Analytics Platform”. Teamet ansvarar och utvecklar vår Azure-baserad dataanalysplattform. Tycker du om att jobba med molnlösningar samt automatisering och vill vara med och påverka, då kan det här vara din nästa möjlighet!*
**Om jobbet**
 Som DevOps Engineer hos oss kommer du att spela en nyckelroll i att utveckla och optimera vår Azure-baserade dataanalysplattform.
   

  

 Arbetsuppgifter och ansvarsområden:
   

  

* Samarbeta med utvecklingsteam och andra intressenter för att förstå deras behov och krav, och säkerställa att plattformen uppfyller dessa.
* Designa, implementera och underhålla CI/CD-pipelines för att säkerställa smidiga och effektiva bygg-, test- och distributionsprocesser.
* Bygga Infrastruktur med hjälp av Infrastructure as Code (IaC)
* Övervaka och optimera plattformens prestanda, tillgänglighet och säkerhet.
* Konsultera och stötta olika utvecklingsteam i deras respektive molnresa.
* Delta i incidenthantering och felsökning.


 Vårt huvudsakliga uppdrag är att tillhandahålla en robust och skalbar dataanalysplattform som möjliggör för våra användare att dra nytta av data på ett effektivt och insiktsfullt sätt. Vi är experterna som säkerställer att plattformen inte bara uppfyller dagens behov, utan också är förberedd för framtidens utmaningar och möjligheter.
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 Du har ett intresse för att utveckla dig själv och gillar att jobba i team med helhetsansvar. Du har erfarenhet av och förståelse för storskaliga molnmiljöer samt enterprise-scale och landing zones. Du har arbetat med att etablera eller utveckla molnbaserade dataplattformar.
   

  

 För att bli framgångsrik i denna roll önskar vi att du har följande:
   

  

* Erfarenhet av Azure-molninfrastruktur och lösningar.
* Förståelse för nätverk, säkerhet och databasadministration i molnmiljöer.
* Erfarenhet av att sätta upp ”self-service platforms”.
* Kunskap i scriptspråk som PowerShell och Bash.
* Relevant utbildning.


 Meriterande:
   

  

* Erfarenhet inom bank eller försäkringssektorn.
* Kunskap inom SQL, C# och .NET.
* Relevanta certifieringar inom molnteknologier.
* Erfarenhet av data engineering och ETL-processer.
* Kännedom om Microsofts ramverk “Cloud Scale Analytics”.


**Om oss**
 Välkommen till Länsförsäkringar och vårt nyetablerade Cloud Data & Analytics Platform-team!
   

  

 Vi är en grupp passionerade och kunniga individer som arbetar tillsammans för att skapa och underhålla vår nya dataanalysplattform. Vårt team består idag av en Product Owner, en Solution Architect och DevOps Engineers, alla med en gemensam vision att leverera högkvalitativa lösningar och expertis inom dataanalys.
   

  

 På Länsförsäkringar är vi mitt i en spännande resa mot molnbaserade lösningar, och dataanalys spelar en central roll i denna förflyttning. Vårt team har stora möjligheter att påverka både sina egna roller och hur vi arbetar tillsammans. Vi värdesätter innovation, samarbete och kontinuerlig förbättring, och vi strävar alltid efter att ligga i framkant av teknologiska framsteg.
   

  

 Vi är stolta över vårt arbete och de framsteg vi gör, och vi ser fram emot att fortsätta vår resa mot att bli ledande inom molnbaserad dataanalys.
   

  

**Mer information**
*Låter det spännande? Då vill vi veta mer om dig! Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag. Vi arbetar löpande med denna rekrytering och kan komma att tillsätta tjänsten innan sista ansökningsdag.*
**Sista ansökningsdag: 2024-10-09**

title: DevSecOps Engineer
description:
Nu har du möjlighet att axla en nyckelroll som DevSecOps Engineer och forma, bygga och säkra morgondagens IT-infrastruktur hos ett bolag där framtiden spelar roll.
 



  





 Tyréns är ett av Sveriges ledande konsultföretag inom samhällsbyggnad. Med 3 000 medarbetare, inklusive tusentals specialister inom stadsutveckling, arkitektur och infrastruktur, bygger de hållbara och innovativa samhällen. Var med och rita morgondagens karta och anta tekniska utmaningar, bidra med innovation och utvecklas längsmed vägen framåt.
 



  





**Om rollen** 




 Som DevSecOps Engineer hos Tyréns får du en central roll i IT-organisationen, där du arbetar nära såväl utvecklings- som driftsteamen för att optimera och säkra Tyréns infrastruktur. Du kommer att bidra till både strategisk och operativ utveckling inom IT, där du driver automatisering, felsökning och säkerhetsintegration men också vidareutvecklar processer och rutiner.
 



  





 Huvuduppgifter arbetsuppgifter:
 


* Förena utvecklings- och driftsprocesser för att skapa en smidig och effektiv miljö
* Integrera säkerhetslösningar i samarbete med utvecklingsteamen
* Felsöka och åtgärda säkerhetsrisker, samt proaktivt arbeta med riskhantering och incidenthantering.
* Automatisera processer för att optimera systemutveckling och drift
* Övervaka och analysera loggar samt systemprestanda för att säkerställa stabilitet och säkerhet.
* Driftsätta och konfigurera hård- och mjukvara på server och klientnivå



  





 Du blir en del ett sammansvetsat och erfaret team som jobbar med allt från avancerad nätverksinfrastruktur till support. Du kommer ha alla möjligheter att forma och påverka såväl innehåll i rollen som vidareutvecklingen av Tyréns IT-landskap, arbetssätt och processer.
 



  





 Möjliga placeringsorter är Stockholm eller Malmö. Tyréns tillämpar en hybrid arbetsmodell där du delvis kan arbeta på distans.
 



  





**Är det här du?** 




 Vi söker dig som har en god förmåga att utmana nuläget och som är lösningsorienterad och självgående. Du tar egna initiativ för att utveckla både dig själv och organisationen. Du är duktig på att skapa samarbete med personer på olika nivåer och är hjälpsam, prestigelös och lyhörd.
 



  





 Du har:
 



  




* Erfarenhet av scriptspråk som exempelvis Python, Powershell och/eller Bash
* Erfarenhet av databasadministration, främst inom MS SQL
* Goda kunskaper inom systemutvecklingsområdet
* Erfarenhet av IT-infrastruktur i större organisationer
* Erfarenhet av serverdrift i Linux och Windows
* Goda kunskaper inom Microsoft Entra, Azure, MS365
* Goda kunskaper inom IT-säkerhet
* Erfarenhet av DevOps (metodik, verktyg, processer)



  





 Meriterande är om du har erfarenhet av administration av databaser, systemkonfiguration och certifieringar inom IT-området. Det är även meriterande om du har erfarenhet av AWS och/eller GCP.
 



  





 Det krävs att du har mycket goda kunskaper, skriftliga såväl som muntliga, i både svenska och engelska.
 








**Intresserad av att ansöka eller få veta mer?** 




 I denna rekrytering samarbetar Tyréns med IDG Recruitment. Vid intresse eller frågor kontakta Alexandra Tihinen, Rekryteringskonsult, på alexandra.tihinen@foundryco.com alternativt 070-447 92 24.
 



  





 För att ansöka, vänligen skicka in ditt CV eller ansök med Linkedin.
 








**Om Tyréns** 




*Tyréns är ett av Sveriges ledande konsultföretag inom samhällsbyggnad. I samspel med kunder och partners skapar vi hållbara lösningar inom stadsutveckling och infrastruktur. Vi har 3 000 medarbetare och verksamhet i Sverige, England, Estland, Litauen, Polen och Bulgarien. Tyréns är stiftelseägt och vår ägandeform gör det möjligt för oss att satsa målmedvetet på forskning och utveckling inom samhällsbyggnadsområdet. Vi drivs av nyfikenhet och har ett nära samarbete med universitet och högskolor.*

title: Embeddedutvecklare inom cybersecurity & cloud
description:
**Företagsbeskrivning**
 AFRY är ett ledande europeiskt företag med global räckvidd inom teknik, design och rådgivning. Vi accelererar omställningen mot ett hållbart samhälle.
   

  

 Vi är 19 000 hängivna experter inom infrastruktur, industri, energi och digitalisering, som skapar hållbara lösningar för kommande generationer.
   

  

 Making Future
   

  

**Jobbeskrivning**
 Är du en mjukvaruutvecklare med stort intresse av inbyggda system och har minst ett års erfarenhet? Vill du ha möjlighet att prova på många olika jobb utan att behöva byta arbetsgivare? Då är konsultrollen på AFRY något för dig! Här får du chansen att utveckla produkter, arbeta i flertalet branscher och företag men samtidigt behålla en trygg och säker anställning.
   

  

 Att jobba som konsult inom inbyggda system på AFRY innebär att du får jobba med kollegor som är hängivna tekniken och ligger i framkant vad gäller både mjuk- och hårdvaruutveckling.
   

  

 På AFRY har du en trygg anställning och vår övertygelse är att nöjda medarbetare är vårt recept för framgång! Vi är måna om att du ska trivas på ditt uppdrag, att du känner att du utvecklas, men också att du har utrymme för en meningsfull fritid.
   

  

 För oss inom produktutveckling har vi ett stort antal kunder inom hela stor-Stockholm, vi har uppdrag inom bland annat konsumentprodukter, energi, elektrifiering, telekommunikation, medicinteknik och försvar. Branschen präglas av innovation och nytänkande både inom hård- och mjukvara. Det finns allt ifrån unga, mindre företag med stor flexibilitet och frihet till stora väletablerade företag med uppstyrda roller och processer. Här finns något för alla! Vanligaste programmeringsspråken är C och C++, men det finns många fler inom detta område. Meriterande är t.ex kunskap inom: Cloud, Cyber Security, Java, Python, C#, Linux, DevOps-kunskaper m.fl.
   

  

 Som konsult kommer dina arbetsuppgifter variera eftersom du kommer delta i små och stora projekt, såväl inhouse som ute hos våra kunder. Beroende på uppdrag kan dina arbetsuppgifter exempelvis vara att utveckla mjukvara för hårdvarunära applikationer. Du kommer arbeta med testramverk och ibland definiera dem. Vidare arbetsuppgifter kan vara att effektivisera och modernisera befintliga produkter för optimal prestanda.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
 Vi söker dig som vill lära nytt och utvecklas hos oss! Vi tror att det du inte redan kan, det kommer du att lära dig. Vågar du utmana, är hängiven tekniken, har ett teambaserat mindset och vill vara en del av ett fantastiskt härligt gäng så kommer du trivas hos oss på AFRY.
   

  

 Du kommer att arbeta agilt och med att utveckla nya eller befintliga system/funktioner i våra kunders system, både egenutvecklade och gemensamma system inom embedded.
   

  

 Vi ser att du har en högskoleutbildning inom relevant område. Eftersom utveckling, modellering och testning sker främst i C/C ++ och i Linuxplattformar är det önskvärt med minst ett par års erfarenhet inom utveckling och/eller test. God svenska och engelska är ett krav då båda språken används dagligen i kontakt med kunder och kollegor.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som är analytisk, orädd och en "doer" som får saker gjorda! Du tycker om att träffa nya människor i olika konstellationer och bryr dig lika mycket om dina kollegor som dina arbetsuppgifter. Du bidrar med din energi och kreativitet och du vill ha roligt på jobbet!
   

  

**Ytterligare information**
 Du kommer att arbeta inom intressanta områden och miljöer med varierande arbetsuppgifter. Din utveckling är central och vi kommer att försöka hitta det uppdrag som passar just dig och din utveckling. Du kommer att tillhöra ett framgångsrikt globalt företag och arbeta tillsammans med inspirerande och engagerade medarbetare. Vi ser varje anställd som en viktig pusselbit i vår gemensamma framgång och arbetar aktivt med att skapa en utvecklande och trivsam arbetsmiljö genom ett personligt ledarskap. Framförallt har vi roligt tillsammans!
   

  

 Om du vill ha en roll med många sociala kontakter kombinerat med spännande teknik är det dig vi söker!
   

  

 För frågor om tjänsten, kontakta rekryterare maja.lindqvist@afry.com
   

  

**Roll:** 
 Embedded Software Developer |
 **Start:** 
 Omgående med hänsyn till uppsägningstid |
 **Placeringsort:** 
 Stockholm |
 **Lön:** 
 Efter överenskommelse
   

  

*På AFRY driver vi förändring i allt vi gör. Vi anser att förändring sker när modiga idéer möts, när vi samarbetar, skapar innovation och omfamnar kreativa lösningar, det är så vi skapar framtiden. Vi söker konstant kvalificerade kandidater som vill ansluta sig till våra inkluderande team runt om i världen. Bli en del av oss och påskynda den gröna omställningen*

title: Resource Coordinator
description:
As a Resource Coordinator at Hypergene, you will play a key role in our customer services department. You will be responsible for ensuring effective resource planning and allocation for our customer projects. Your mission is to ensure that the right person gets the right task and that resources for each project are maximized. You report to VP Expert Services / Head of Operations.

**Tasks and responsibilities**

* Support the effective capacity planning and resource assignment through establishing skills matrices and working to automate and scale process for different types of services engagements and queries
* Assigning resources to projects and tasks including matching the right personnel to the right roles.
* Forecasting the need for new employees for upcoming projects.
* Identifying and matching qualifications of new employees to project needs.
* Managing resource needs for the consulting department’s approximately 80 consultants and project managers, creating conditions for successful project deliveries.
* Handling incoming incidents from customers that consultants need to support, ensuring quick and effective problem resolution.
* Continuously ensuring that the process for resource allocation and planning is optimal and supporting the department in achieving our key performance indicators for resource utilization.
* Working actively in our modern cloud platform for Project & Resource Planning with analysis, follow-up, and reporting.

**Qualifications and experience**

* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills including fluency in both written and spoken communication including Swedish and English.
* Strong time management skills and the ability to prioritise competing workloads effectively.
* A methodical approach to planning workloads with problem-solving skills.
* Personal leadership and charisma that will support you in making the resource planning successful with the colleagues.
* Ability to work under pressure to complete tasks sometimes under tight deadlines.
* Project management skills such as status reporting, reporting preparation resource planning and occasional delegation.
* Excellent computer skills including spreadsheet.
* It is meritorious if you have an additional language capability such as German and if you have previous work experience in a resource co-ordination role (applications will be favourably viewed in that context) and working with a project planning and resource system.

**What we offer**

This is a chance for you to accelerate your career and succeed in an environment where you will have the possibility to make a very positive daily impact. Every day you will work alongside helpful and down-to-earth colleagues who are dedicated and ambitious. We fully recognize that it is our employees that make Hypergene a success and if you are the right person for the role we will offer you exciting and developing assignments combined with competitive salary and benefits supporting a fantastic journey within a dynamic high-growth business.


Submit your application today! We look forward to getting to know you and exploring how we can continue to develop Hypergene's success together. You can write the application in Swedish or English.

title: Senior Penetration Tester
description:
Location: Stockholm, Sweden

  


**About Us**

  

Integrity360 is one of Europe’s leading cyber security specialists operating from office locations spread out across Europe, providing a comprehensive range of professional, support and managed cyber security services for our 300+ clients. With four top-class Security Operation Centers, we offer a complete end-to-end security services covering our clients’ security from every angle. Our services include Managed Security, Cyber Security Testing, Incident Response, Security Integration, PCI Compliance and Cyber Risk & Assurance services.

  

What sets Integrity360 apart is our excellent team of people that drive the business forward. The company was founded with a focus on technical expertise and that philosophy remains today. The skills and experience in our company are some of the greatest in the industry and clients remain with Integrity360 because they can rely on and trust us to go above and beyond to ensure their needs are met. Listed multiple times on Gartner Market Guides for Managed Security Services.

 **Job Role / Responsibilities**



This is a full-time position with the Integrity360 office in Stockholm, Sweden. The position is responsible for performing all forms of complex technical activities (including the Internal / External Network, Applications, Cloud, Mobile, etc.). These assessments will occasionally be done at the client site, primarily in Sweden. Proficiency in communication is essential, both written and verbal, as well as the ability to convey complex technical information to key international clients.

 **Primary Duties/Responsibilities include:**


* Perform in-depth penetration tests across applications, infrastructure, cloud and mobile platforms.
* Execute zero-knowledge black-box, grey-box and white-box penetration tests of specific areas within the enterprise.
* Perform tests and assessments in the cloud, including but not limited to AWS, Azure, GCP, etc.
* Perform security reviews of servers, network devices, architecture and application designs.
* Act as an escalation point for team members regarding project-related issues.
* Deliver pre-sales support, including project scoping, estimations, and technical assistance via calls, meetings, and presentations with key clients.
* Enhance Integrity360's security offerings, refining methodologies, reporting standards, and educational materials.
* Represent Integrity360 at international events, forums or training events.
* Demonstrate the ability to be an industry expert.

  


**Required Skills / Experience**


* 5+ or more years’ experience in penetration testing or red team operations, including testing critical functionality, banking systems and more.
* Manual penetration testing experience above and beyond running automated tools.
* Expertise in AWS, Azure, and cloud-native technologies, including VMs, containers, and infrastructure as code.
* Previous experience as a Subject Matter Expert, or similar role.
* Experience in testing ICS, SCADA, mainframes, containers, hardware appliances,
* Excellent understanding of firewalls, proxies, iptables, AVs and EDR products, VPNs, IDS/IPS, and various networking concepts.
* Knowledge of wireless technologies, mainly RF, Cellular, NFC, and Bluetooth technology.
* Experience in testing OSX / iOS and Android devices.
* Excellent communication and presentation skills in front of key clients.
* Experience in developing custom security tools and scripts.
* Fluency in one or more programming or scripting languages: Java, Python, C/C++, C#, .NET, ASP, PHP,

  


**Certifications/Qualifications**


* One or more industry leading certification (OSCP, CRTE, CRTO, OSCE, OSWP, ARTE, CPTS, etc.)
* CHECK Team Leader or equivalent is a plus.
* Computer Sciences, IT or Cybersecurity related degree is a plus.

title: Microsoft Security Specialist
description:
**About Us**



Integrity360 is an the largest independent cybersecurity provider in UK&I, with Security Operations Centers in Dublin & Sofia, employing 310+ employees, of which over 80% are technical. We help our clients proactively identify, protect, detect and respond to threats against the ever-evolving threat landscape. Our security first approach positions security as an enabler and empowers our clients to do business securely.

  

You would be joining Integrity360 at an immensely exciting time. In June 2021 the company received a strategic investment from August Equity (one of the UK’s most successful mid-market private equity firms). Our intention is to grow Integrity360 into the leading cyber services and solutions provider in Europe. The market for cybersecurity services has never been stronger and is growing at an aggressive rate. Integrity360 is one of the most respected and established service providers in the industry and is well positioned to achieve a market leadership position over the coming years. We believe we have significant opportunities for growth especially over the next 36 months. With the right levels of energy, tenacity and skill, your opportunity for personal success and contribution to our overall aspirations is considerable.

 **Job Role / Responsibilities**

  

The Technical consultant will work closely with the professional services and MDR teams to deliver growth and commercial success through working with and assisting in the Development of Integrity360’s Cybersecurity Services portfolio, and Managed Detection and Response in particular. We have a large portfolio of Endpoint protection vendors that we deliver Professional Services and training courses on. This individual will have a great understanding of cybersecurity needs and related solutions and managed services across its many domains and knows what excellence looks like to deliver on Enterprise customer expectations. In the past months we have built a very successful Microsoft Services Department that needs to be expanded due to customer demand specialising in Defender ATP and the M365 security stack. We have great demand from our customers to deploy Defender ATP and assistance in getting the most out of their M365\E5 product entitlement.

 **Key Responsibilities**

  

* Technical market research in the field of managed cyber security services, platforms, and solutions
* Assisting sales in winning deals, architecting deployments, and performing the technical delivery and training on the solutions.
* Technical input into business case development to justify proposed investments in managed services.
* Work with subject-matter experts in the business to build great services.
* Perform on site or remote assessments, consultancy and HLD and LLD design services featuring the M365 security stack, and more.

  


**Candidate requirements**

  

* Advanced Windows Server and Desktop operational and troubleshooting knowledge.
* Excellent understanding of Active Directory and Group Policy architecture
* Good knowledge of VMWare\HyperV, Azure
* Experience supporting and administration of Microsoft SQL, Microsoft Exchange, Exchange Online, Intune, Defender ATP and SCCM. M365 security stack consulting experience (Defender ATP all the way to Identity and Cloud is a must)
* Experience with Windows 7-11. Experience with Linux is a plus.
* Good understanding of TCP/IP networking.
* Ability to communicate technical information to nontechnical personnel.
* Ability to manage client expectation.
* Ability to prioritise your own time.
* A real passion for technology.
* Excellent documentation skills.
* A sense of good customer service
* A strong team player
* Practical deployment, architecture, and consultative experience in scoping, installing, auditing, configuring, and training on the technical solutions mentioned in this document.
* Understanding of CASB, SSE, ZTNA, ATP, EDR, NDR, XDR, SOC, SIEM, SOAR, CNAP, DLP, NGAV, Web and Email security software, Vulnerability management, Mitre ATT&CK Framework Fundamentals, NIST / ISO/IEC 270001 Frameworks, HIPAA Governance Frameworks, GDPR Policy Frameworks, LM (Lockheed Martin) Cyber Kill Chain

  


**What you will bring to us:**

  

* Should have previous experience in professional services. managed security services, preferably in a next generation SOC environment or in an MSSP or MDR provider.
* Experience with Endpoint Security Implementation / Management
* Experience in Customer Service Environments
* Skills and experience in detection and response operations and services is a major plus.
* Good understanding of the security vendor and vendor category landscape
* Relevant Cyber Security certifications
* Initiative and focus on continuous improvement.
* Must be systems and process oriented, and a self-motivated learner.
* Experience with administering enterprise servers and other systems.
* Proficiency in all aspects of system administration and engineering of Microsoft technologies to deploy and maintain global infrastructure services in our enterprise with an emphasis on the platforms mentioned.

  


**Qualifications**

  

* Must be educated to degree level or similar
* CompTIA A+
* CompTIA N+
* CompTIA Security+
* Microsoft – MS-500
* Microsoft – AZ-500
* Microsoft Configuration Manager (SCCM) Management / Configuration
* Microsoft Intune / Endpoint Manager Management / Configuration
* Microsoft Active Directory Domain Administration
* Microsoft Azure Active Directory Management
* Microsoft Data Loss Protection Management / Configuration
* Microsoft PIM (Identity and Access Management Management) Management / Configuration
* Microsoft Security Centre Management / Configuration
* Microsoft Cloud App Security

  


**Additional Knowledge (will contribute to your application):**


* Trend, Trellix\Mcafee\Skyhigh, Carbon black, Varonis, CrowdStrike, Mimecast, Rapid 7, Qualys, Splunk, Vectra, CyberArk, Microsoft Sentinel, AZ-800, AZ-801, SC-100, SC-200, SC-400

title: Customer Success Technology Manager
description:
We are Sinch. Join us and be a part of a global leader in Communication Platforms as a Service (CPaaS) and mobile customer engagement. With presence in more than 60 countries, we leverage innovative technology to enable companies to engage and interact with their users across voice, messaging, and video.
  
  

**The essence of the role :**  

We are seeking a proactive and results-driven Customer Success Manager to join our dynamic IT Sales and Marketing technology team. In this role, you will lead customer relationships, ensure client satisfaction, and drive the successful adoption of our technology solutions.
  
This role is based in Stockholm and offers a hybrid work model reporting to the VP Sales and Marketing Applications.
  
  

**As our new Customer Success Manager, you will:**  

* Be the main point of contact for assigned clients, building and maintaining strong, long-term relationships. Understand their goals and challenges to provide tailored solutions.
* Lead the onboarding process, ensuring a smooth transition and successful implementation of our technology solutions.
* Provide training and resources to help clients enhance their understanding and usage of our solutions.
* Monitor usage and engagement to identify potential issues or growth opportunities. Develop and execute account plans to drive customer success and achieve retention and expansion targets.
* Collaborate with the sales team to identify upsell and cross-sell opportunities within the client base.
* Serve as the voice of the customer within Sinch, ensuring their feedback informs product improvements. Partner with product and development teams to improve customer experience.
* Track key metrics like customer satisfaction, renewal rates, and product adoption. Share insights with senior management on customer success activities and outcomes.
* Anticipate potential issues and collaborate with internal teams to resolve them before they impact the customers. Manage escalations promptly and effectively.
* Manage a team of core marketing, sales and service technologies to continue to develop the product roadmap and drive adoption of each technology through-out the organisation.


**Who are you?:**  

We believe you have a strong understanding of sales and marketing technologies, along with excellent communication and interpersonal skills, a proactive problem-solving approach, and a genuine drive to help clients achieve their business goals.
  
* Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, I.T, or related field.
* Demonstrated ability in customer success, account management, or similar role within the technology sector.
* Proven track record of managing customer relationships and driving successful outcomes.
* Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams.
* Proficiency in CRM software and other customer success tools.


**Preferred Qualifications:**  

* Experience in the IT Sales and Marketing technology industry.
* Familiarity with SaaS platforms and cloud-based solutions.
* Skilled at managing multiple accounts and projects simultaneously.


**Benefits::**  

At Sinch, we support employees with benefits that adapt regionally, ensuring you have the resources need to thrive. These include health and life insurance, flexible work environment, retirement savings plans, and more.
  
  

**Are you ready? Join us on our journey! :**  

We will review applications on a rolling basis. Apply soon by submitting your application in English.
  
At Sinch, we value learning, embrace change, and offer opportunities for personal and professional growth. Unfortunately, we can only consider applicants who hold Swedish or EU/EEA citizenship or have a valid work permit for Sweden.
company_description: We help companies to communicate with customers via messaging, voice and video using multiple channels. Simplifying life by bringing all people and businesses together using technology is our purpose.

title: Senior Data and ML Engineer
description:
**Join our Team**
-----------------


**About this opportunity:**  

  

We are launching an exciting SaaS initiative that aims to overhaul how we deliver solutions, using As-a-Service on public Hyper Cloud Providers (HCP) as our vehicle. Our goal is twofold: To thrill our customers by delivering services they love and giving them a competitive edge, while building a “lean and mean” product development organization that will allow Ericsson to scale at profit. You will be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You will be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.  

If you're passionate about fostering modern product development paradigms, inspiring change, shaping innovative technology to deliver customer value, and you get a kick about building something entirely new, we want you on board!

  

This is a hybrid position based at our Ireland Athlone Office. More information about Ericsson Athlone: VIDEO: Ericsson Athlone Careers: Join us at Ericsson Ireland  

  

**Why join Solution Area Sapper:**  

  

Ericsson Cloud Software & Services (BCSS) continues to evolve cloud-native portfolio as well as explores new ways of building solutions, including enabling cloud native “as-a-Service” offerings. The newly established Sapper unit will ensure BCSS readiness for “as-a-Service” when our customers start shifting towards new network operations models that could truly maximise the opportunities and agility cloud native deployment brings. We have chosen a less traditional name for our new acceleration unit to signal that this unit will operate differently. The name Sapper originates from a soldier who performs ambitious tasks that require engineering skills, a pioneer with deep technical understanding.  

  

With us, you will have an outstanding opportunity: The chance to use your skills and creativity to push the boundaries of what is possible. To build never seen before solutions to some of the world’s toughest problems.


Within this new area, we are building a number of teams and this particular job specification is for a position as part of the Management Plane Team. In this team we will have responsibility to design and develop the Network Management of this new ‘Core Network as a Service’ offering, and by that we mean functionality such as Life cycle management, Orchestration, Configuration Management, Performance Management, among others. So we aim to design and implement a truly global SaaS management suite with a best in class User interface to manage public cloud deployed Services and infrastructure.

**Why join our team:**
----------------------



We are building a dream team, and this is what we are after…

* Innovative atmosphere. Be part of a creative, forward-thinking team dedicated to revolutionizing the way we do software.
* Collaborative culture. Work alongside dedicated engineers who share your passion for technology and community building.
* Strong sense of purpose and high impact. Shape the future of our products and directly impact the experience of our customers and developers across our global company.
* Psychological safety. An environment where team members feel comfortable trying new things, voicing their ideas and admitting mistakes without fear of negative repercussions.
* Career growth. We invest in your development, offering opportunities to enhance your skills and advance your career.
* Endless possibilities. Your ideas and innovations won’t just be heard – they’ll be the driving force behind our success.
**What you will do:**
---------------------


* Design and develop a truly global SaaS Management Plane to manage our ‘as a service’ offerings.
* Work in an agile team using Lean, Agile and DevSecOps methodologies and tooling
* Collaborate with other development teams to ensure our Management SW applications fit and function as part of the overall solution.
* Stay up to date with industry standard methodologies and emerging technologies

 **The skills you bring:**  

  

* Proficient in Python, Java and Scala
* Experience in the design and implementation of data platforms (ingestion, storage, processing, serving, policy, governance, compliance, security)
* Experience with one or more from Kafka, Hadoop, HBase, Spark, Flink, Airflow
* Experience in Machine Learning
* Bonus qualifications include experience with GCP Big Query, PubSub, Dataflow, Vertex AI, Workflows, Composer
* Experience of programming languages such as Go, Java, Javascript
* Experience of designing APIs (Sync and Async) such as REST, gRPC
* Experience or knowledge of secure design and secure coding (SAST) and DAST
* Experience developing applications in a public cloud such as GCP, AWS, Azure
* Cloud native tools and technologies: containers, Kubernetes
* Knowledge of DevSecOps and CICD and related tools
* Knowledge of Telecoms and in particular Network Management is an advantage
 **Why join Ericsson?**


At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.  

  

**What happens once you apply?**


Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.


Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.

**Primary country and city:** [[Ireland / Sweden]] || [[Athlone/Stockholm]]
company_description: Do you want to be part of shaping the future? From making connectivity more accessible to the latest IoT solutions, you have an opportunity to be where it begins.

title: Salesforceutvecklare
description:
* *Urval sker löpande*
* *Stockholm*
* *Hybrid*
***Arbetsuppgifter***
---------------------

*Vi söker nu en erfaren Salesforceutvecklare med integrationserfarenhet till Handelsbanken. I denna roll kommer du att ny- och vidareutveckla vår CRM-plattform i Salesforce.*

***Ditt team***  

*Som Salesforce utvecklare kommer du bli en del av plattform- och integrationsteamet som idag består av Salesforce- och Javautvecklare samt kravspecialister. Du kommer utöver ditt närmsta team samarbeta nära områdets 3 övriga Salesforce team samt Arkitekter.*

***Din roll***  

*I rollen som Salesforceutvecklare kommer du vara med i design och skapande av arkitektur samt hantera och strukturera stora mängder data från olika källor. Du kommer ansvara för säkerhet, pipelines och integrationslösningar inom vår CRM-plattform. Därtill kommer du agera mentor och leda utvecklingen genom utbildning inom teamet.*

***Vi har riktigt bra förmåner***
---------------------------------

* *Tjänstepension*
* *Vinstdelningssystem*
* *Gruppförsäkring*
* *Friskvårdsbidrag*
* *Bidrag vid föräldraledighet*
* *Banktjänster*
* *Banking services*
* *Benefit in connection with parental leave*
* *Health promotion subsidy*
* *Group insurance*
* *Occupational pension*
* *Profit-sharing scheme*
***Kvalifikationer***
---------------------

***Din profil***  

*Vi ser att du har hög kompetensnivå inom Salesforceapplikationen där du har en djup förståelse för de olika produkterna och kan agera mentor till ditt team och övriga organisationen. Du har omfattande arbetslivserfarenhet från att leda och utveckla lösningar inom Salesforceplattformen men även erfarenhet av att designa och utveckla användarorienterade, effektiva, och skalbara Salesforceapplikationer enligt bästa praxis i den senaste tekniken.*

*Därtill har du flera års operativ erfarenhet av utveckling och implementation av Lightning Components, Apex Controllers, Batch Apex, Schedulers och Apex Triggers. Du har varit involverad i större implementeringar av Salesforce i en stor organisation, gärna inom bank och finans. Du har erfarenhet av att integrera Salesforce med externa applikationer med hjälp av tredjepartsverktyg via SOAP och REST API-integration samt certifieringar inom Salesforce tex Salesforce Administrator, Plattform Developer 1, Sales cloud och Service cloud. Därtill har du erfarenhet av utveckling i molnlösning, Linux och virtuella datormiljöer samt agil metodik.*

*Då vi samarbetar med hela organisationen behöver du behärska god svenska och engelska i tal och skrift.*

*Som person samarbetar du prestigelöst i team för att nå gemensamma mål där du leder arbetet och agerar mentor vid behov. Du tar självständigt ansvar för att hitta lösningar genom att se mönster och samband i mellan koden, IT-miljöer och användarens behov. Då systemen är kritiska är det även viktig att du kan följa befintlig struktur och processer, men även skapa egna vid behov.*

***Vi erbjuder***

* *en trygg och stabil arbetsgivare*
* *dynamiskt och stimulerande arbete*
* *work-life balance*
* *kompetens- och karriärutveckling*
* *inkluderande- och jämställd arbetsmiljö*
* *konkurrenskraftigt förmånspaket*

***Kontaktuppgifter***

***Chef:*** *Erica Sandahl, erica.sandahl@handelsbanken.se*  

***TA:*** *Sofia Åkerblom, sofia.akerblom@handelsbanken.se*  

***Fackliga representanter Finansförbundet:*** *Ann-Kristin Sundborg, ann-kristin.sundborg@handelsbanken.se*  

***Fackliga representanter Akademikerföreningen:*** *Margareta Landgren, margareta.landgren@handelsbanken.se*

***Välkommen med din ansökan***

* *#LI-SA1*

  
**Om företaget**
----------------

Hos oss får du ett stort eget ansvar och möjlighet att påverka din egen och bankens framtida utveckling. Våra olika perspektiv, insikter och innovativa idéer utgör en grund för hur vi tillsammans bygger vidare banken för framtiden. För oss är utveckling allt och när du utvecklas, utvecklas banken.


Vi har ett unikt sätt att bedriva bank som bygger på en stark tilltro och respekt för den enskilda människan. Våra värderingar och starka företagskultur har en avgörande betydelse för vår framgång och guidar oss om hur vi uppnår våra mål, samarbetar och stöttar varandra. Genom stark lokal förankring, ett decentraliserat arbetssätt och ett långsiktigt perspektiv skapar vi hållbara relationer genom livets olika skeenden. Hos oss på Handelsbanken är alla viktiga. Vi kommer från olika platser med olika bakgrund, erfarenhet och utbildning. Tillsammans är vi Handelsbanken.  



  

Mer om Handelsbanken *Mer om Handelsbanken*

*TOM* *Bildades 1871*

*TOM* *En av världens starkaste banker*

*TOM* *All verksamhet utgår från kunden*

title: Sales Engineer EMEA
description:
***Net Insight’s solutions make it possible for you and millions of other viewers around the globe to take part in the largest live broadcast events. Net Insight’s 25 year history as recognized leader in media encoding, adaptation, and transport, has grown to include solutions to address video over well-managed infrastructure, unmanaged Internet transmission, and now cloud-based media switching and adaptation.***

***Our Nimbra solutions combine with Nimbra Edge cloud components to create one of the most versatile product portfolios to meet the changing demands of today’s media producers and consumers.***

***Do you enjoy being the trusted technical advisor and at the same time have a passion for business? This is your opportunity. It is important that you enjoy working with global customers and an advantage if you have experience from linear broadcast and streaming solutions as well as cloud technologies.***

 ***Do you want to shape the future with us?***

 **ABOUT THE POSITION**


Our Sales Engineering team is seeking a Sales Engineer with a pro-active, customer-oriented approach, to support our media sales in EMEA.


As a Sales Engineer, you will be a key member of the Sales team for our Media products. You will work closely with both the Account Manager and directly with the customers – building strong, trust-based customer relationships. You will provide technical designs, guidance, systems costs, and help develop the business model. You will work with sales colleagues to pitch Net Insight products and solutions to our customers in the DACH and Scandinavian regions. You will be closely supported by a wider community of colleagues as needed – Product management, R&D, Customer Support, Senior colleagues, and peers.


Your key responsibilities in this area will be:

* Discovery of the customer opportunity and engaging the end customer.
* Understand the customer’s unmet needs and identify areas for growth and optimization.
* Define the architectural concepts and gather detailed knowledge required to provide a competitive solution – compliant with the end to end workflow.
* Provide System level designs, costs, and proposals based on Net Insight’s portfolio of hardware and software media solutions, scalable to meet anticipated business needs.
* Deliver compelling presentations to existing and potential customers, promoting the commercial and technical virtues of the solution
* Establishing personal credibility with the customer by providing technical insight into business and network analysis.
* Use and manage customer demonstration systems showcasing Net Insight products – including at trade shows

Be the voice of the client and provide feedback to product and engineering teams influencing future product and solution roadmaps.  

* 

**YOUR BACKGROUND**


To succeed in this role, we believe it’s critical you can analyse and understand complex customer problems, as well as explain technical solutions as part of the job. You are a self-motivated and committed person who always strives for personal development. As a person, you actively seek knowledge when required and enjoy being in contact with people, both inside and outside Net Insight.

  

We believe you have most or all of the following:

* Self-motivation is key, with the ability to work remotely
* Ideally, you’ll have proven Sales Engineering / Pre-Sales experience gained within the Media industry. However, we’re also open to individuals who sit on the engineering side in our industry as an Engineer, or someone in Product Management who wants to utilise their technical expertise in a sales-based setting directly with customers.
* University degree in engineering or field related to products and solutions being sold preferred or equivalent in work experience
* Current knowledge of media encoding and transmission technologies
* Practical knowledge of IP and Ethernet networking, routing, and switching
* Practical knowledge of IT infrastructure, including Linux, bare metal, VMs, Public Cloud (including Kubernetes & Docker)
* Excellent oral and written communications and presentation skills, and comfortable running a demo
* Commercial skills – ability to design and promote solutions based on value
* Keen interest in the media technology industry - and able to connect trends/intel to your work
* Able to work with multiple concurrent opportunities – prioritising based on dialogue
* *Being able to speak German would also be advantageous but not essential*

  

**WELCOME TO APPLY**


The position is a permanent, full-time employment located in our headquarters in Solna Business Park, Sweden. We value work life balance; therefore, you can combine remote work and working from the office.


To apply for the position, please submit your C.V. or resume through this page. For more information about the position, please contact recruiting manager Max Owen at max.owen@netinsight.net.

 **ABOUT NET INSIGHT**

*Net Insight (Nasdaq: NETI B) provides the highest performing, most open video transport and media cloud technology for content providers as the industry standard for flexibility and service across live contribution, distribution and remote production media workflows.*

*For over 25 years, the world’s leading content owners, broadcasters, production companies, service providers and enterprises have trusted Net Insight’s Emmy Award winning Nimbra technology to guarantee media delivery. Today, Net Insight partners with hundreds of customers in over 70 countries to ensure media flows across managed and unmanaged IP networks, and the cloud – from anywhere, to everywhere. It enables customers to get the best from any mix of virtualized, cloud and IP technology and is the only platform to support all the major industry standards, protocols and clouds.*

*Welcome to Net Insight, where* ***innovation****,* ***collaboration****, and* ***trust*** *are the cornerstones of our success. As one team, we are committed to delivering value to our customers, contributing to the growth and success of our company. Together we create a dynamic and positive workplace where everyone is valued, engaged and empowered to make an impact*

title: Knowledge Graph consultant
description:
**Insights & data is a global business line within Capgemini, comprising 27,000 experts. Our focus? Creating cutting-edge machine learning and AI solutions on reliable, scalable data platforms. From Gen-AI to business intelligence, we cover it all. Join us in transforming industries through end-to-end Data & AI solutions. We work across industries and have a collaborative environment, where your unique perspective matters.**  

**Join our team as a Knowledge Graph consultant!**  

  

**YOUR ROLE**  

**Are you passionate about shaping the future through data-driven insights? Imagine a role where you collaborate with clients, unravel complex challenges, and drive meaningful impact. As a Knowledge Graph consultant, you’ll be at the forefront of innovation, using semantic technology and other modern tech stacks like Generative AI or LLM to transform businesses.**  



**What You’ll Do:**  

* **Semantic Technologies:** **We work with clients using a wide range of tools such as the whole of W3C Semantic Stack (RDF, RDFS, SPARQL, OWL, SHACL), graph databases, ontology modelling and tech stack such as Neo4j or other Labeled Property Graph implementations.**
* **Data Alchemy:** **Dive into data wrangling, craft algorithms, and deploy solutions that matter and create insights. ETL processes with various graph databases.**
* **Data Modeling:** **Craft effective data models that represent business entities and relationships.**
* **Wide Horizons:** **From tackling the complexities of fraud detection to enhancing user experiences through sophisticated product recommendation, the variety is vast.**
* **Cloud Expertise:** **We’re all about Databricks and cloud platforms (Azure, AWS, Google Cloud).**
* **Knowledge Sharing:** **We actively promote knowledge sharing and skills development at Capgemini. You’ll belong to specific areas of expertise (capability area), where lessons learnt, and experiences are shared. We think you will be happy to help upskill our junior talents if need be.**
* **Client Interaction:** **As part of a team, you’ll engage with clients, understanding their needs and developing optimal technical solutions, for them to become more data-driven.**
* **Flexible Approach:** **We are seeking a dynamic consultant who is eager to primarily focus on knowledge graph development, while also being flexible and enthusiastic about contributing to various data science projects if needed.**
* **International Collaborations:** **Our Knowledge graph team in I&D Sweden are collaborating with our neighboring countries. This opens up the opportunity for our Knowledge graph consultants to work internationally if that is within your interests.**
**YOUR PROFILE**  

* **Experience:** **With domain experience in knowledge graph technologies, you also enjoy solving complex modeling problems. You have experience in Interaction with graph databases through standardized APIs and query languages.**
* **Programming skills:** **Programming skills (specific language is not required, but we use Python or Java).**
* **Knowledge:** **Knowledge about Linked Data Concepts & Information and Data Management**
* **Pedagogical Flair:** **Comfortable explaining Knowledge graph to clients or stakeholders.**
* **Academic Roots:** **Math’s, Statistics or Data science—your foundation matters.**
* **Language Mastery:** **You speak Swedish and English fluently—essential for client interactions.**
  

**Bonus Points for:**  

* **Generative AI:** **Unleash creativity.**
* **MLOps Champion:** **CI/CD, continuous training—your playground.**
* **Stable Solutions:** **Kubernetes and Docker mastery.**
* **Business Acumen:** **Beyond code, grasp the bigger picture.**
**WHAT WE BELIEVE YOU WILL ENJOY ABOUT WORKING HERE**  

**We recognize the significance of flexible work arrangements to provide support. Be it remote work , or flexible work hours, you will get an environment to maintain healthy work life balance.**  

**At the heart of our mission is your career growth. Our array of career growth programs and diverse professions are crafted to support you in exploring a world of opportunities.**  

**Equip yourself with valuable certifications in the latest technologies, for example within Semantics or Generative AI.**  

  

**APPLICATION**  

**Ready to shape the future? Apply now.**  



**ABOUT CAPGEMINI**  

**Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world while creating a tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market-leading capabilities in AI, cloud, and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2023 global revenues of €22.5 billion.**

**Get The Future You Want | www.capgemini.com**
company_description: Capgemini is a global leader in partnering with companies to transform and manage their business by harnessing the power of technology.

title: Experienced professionals to our SAP Finance team (Stockholm)
description:
Deloitte is looking for talented and experienced professionals to join our SAP-team in Sweden. As a market leader, we work with both global and local organizations on complex transformations, including major business-driven IT changes. With approximately 25,000 SAP experts in over 135 countries, Deloitte is among SAP’s most valued strategic partners. This is why SAP has placed Deloitte within the highest strategic alliance partner category, and why we have been recognized as the Global Leader in SAP Services by leading consultancies and analysts such as Forrester and Gartner.


We are looking for **senior SAP Finance professionals** who have an appetite for delivering sustainable, business-driven projects and being excited to co-operate with the largest companies and well-known brands. You enjoy engaging with clients to understand their requirements and find solution options for key challenges in finance area providing subject matter expertise with a good awareness of SAP and associated technologies within the process area.


**Qualifications**
------------------

Your most important attributes we’d like to see are:


* Thorough expertise in finance related SAP S/4HANA areas/competences such as Central Finance, FI/CO, Margin & Profitability Analysis, Project accounting with PS, Product Costing, Master Data modelling, Understanding of end to end process like Order to Cash, Procure to Pay or other
* Good understanding of SAP S/4HANA product roadmap (experience of other related SAP solutions such as e.g. Group Reporting, SAC is advantageous but not required) and knowledge of relevant delivery methods for SAP (waterfall, hybrid agile, agile) preferably with deployment experience e.g. global template rollouts
* Great addition (but not must) if the candidate has a high level understanding of the SAP cloud offerings -RISE and GROW

Additionally, to ensure smooth start and succeeding in the role, it is required from the applicant to:


* Hold a master’s degree or similar relevant educational background with years of relevant SAP experience - preferably across multiple industries. Broad SAP functional and technical expertise in your own process area with a good understanding of integrations between SAP modules and other applications
* Have previous consulting, project delivery and sales/pre-sales experience working with multiple large clients both with business and IT stakeholders
* Be fluent in both written and spoken English with excellent communication and presentation skills, and an ability to conceptualize and communicate complex topics in a clear and understandable manner. Proficiency in Swedish language seen as an advantage but is not required.
**Additional Information**
--------------------------

**We offer**

At Deloitte, we are committed to helping our employees grow and develop throughout their career. We offer a range of on-the-job learning experiences, formal development programs at Deloitte University, and access to a personal coach to support you in identifying and utilizing your strengths. We also provide the necessary training and resources for you to obtain various certifications to further advance in your career.
  

  

Our culture is built on collaboration and innovation. We value diverse perspectives and encourage our employees to think creatively to find the best solutions for our clients. We work hand-in-hand with our clients to understand their unique needs and to develop tailored solutions that drive growth and innovation. At Deloitte, you´ll have the chance to grow and succeed alongside like-minded professionals who share your passion.
  

  

**How to apply**

Your application should consist of a CV and a cover letter and you apply directly online. Please apply as soon as possible as we will review applications and interview candidates on an ongoing basis.
  

  

*As a qualitative part of Deloitte's recruitment process, our final candidates undergo a background check, to increase awareness of our future employees, secure the working environment for our employees and meet regulatory requirements. The background check process is carried out in collaboration with To Find Out.* *https://tofindout.se/en/background-check/*  

  

**Questions?**

For questions regarding the application process or the role, please contact Rasmus Öhman, rohman@deloitte.se .
  

  

**We are looking forward to your application!**  

  

For further information on Deloitte, please visit www.deloitte.se


**What impact will you make?**

Every day, your work will make an impact that matters, while you thrive in a dynamic culture of inclusion, collaboration and high performance. We do not just aspire to make solutions. We wish to create an impact that makes a positive and crucial difference for the people around us, our clients and our society. Deloitte is where you’ll find unlimited opportunities to succeed and realize your full potential.


**Job Location**
----------------
company_description: We’re a leading professional services firm, but what makes working at Deloitte unique? When you join us, you become connected. To inspiring people. To meaningful work with fascinating clients.

title: Enterprise Architect
description:
Your work days are brighter here.
At Workday, it all began with a conversation over breakfast. When our founders met at a sunny California diner, they came up with an idea to revolutionize the enterprise software market. And when we began to rise, one thing that really set us apart was our culture. A culture which was driven by our value of putting our people first. And ever since, the happiness, development, and contribution of every Workmate is central to who we are. Our Workmates believe a healthy employee-centric, collaborative culture is the essential mix of ingredients for success in business. That’s why we look after our people, communities and the planet while still being profitable. Feel encouraged to shine, however that manifests: you don’t need to hide who you are. You can feel the energy and the passion, it's what makes us unique. Inspired to make a brighter work day for all and transform with us to the next stage of our growth journey? Bring your brightest version of you and have a brighter work day here.
About the Team
This is the opportunity to be part of building something incredible alongside some of the most hard-working individuals in the market! You will be supported and surrounded by some of the brightest people in the industry. People who care about our customers and care about helping them achieve the results they seek.  

  

Our Solution Consultant team is a strategic partner to the sales organization and responsible for building a compelling vision of the Workday solution for our customers and prospects in some of the largest customers in the world. We take our culture as a key foundation to the way we work together and how we hold each other accountable.  

We offer an excellent benefits scheme that includes company holiday days, pension, health care, employee assistance, fitness program, family support, and many other features.
About the Role
Workday is looking for an outstanding Technical Presales Specialist to be a part of our specialised Solution Consulting team supporting and promoting the technical aspect of the selling engagement.
This is your chance to represent and sell the next generation of ERP cloud applications. Through interactive discoveries, you will analyse an organization's needs and demonstrate how Workday's Enterprise Applications can address the customer’s requirements and solve their strategic business concerns with the special focus on technical integration into the existing IT landscape of the customer. Expect this to involve presenting to all levels of IT, demonstrating functionality in Workday and building rapid prototypes.  

Responsibilities:* Articulating the value and expanding adoption of the Workday platform (including platform of acquired products) to different buyer stakeholders / C-Levels, in particular the CIO.
* Centre of Excellence for technical topics on Workday Extend, Strategic Sourcing and Planning.
* Describing the technical architecture of the Workday solutions.
* Highlighting the advantages of a cloud based SaaS offering vs traditional on-premise installations.
* Discussing the fit and value of Workday’s Extend offering for potential buyer use cases.
* Creating an engaging experience for the prospect’s technically oriented audience.
* Understanding and communicating the Security, Data Privacy, Performance and Support aspects of the Workday SaaS offering.


About You
Candidates interested in joining the Workday Solution Consulting team as an Enterprise Architect must exhibit a strong combination of technical skills, industry experience and an unimpeachable “stage presence”. Articulating and differentiating the Workday technical foundation and delivery model requires:* 3+ years of software / IT presales experience
* A strong technical knowledge including but not limited to:  

Java scripting, Python , Data modelling skills or other modern programming languages including working with REST/SOAP APIs for integrations.
* Software as a Service work experience and/or knowledge of the delivery model and associated characteristics
* Comprehensive security background covering encryption technologies, network architectures, communications security, SAML (single sign-on), and application level access methods
* Experience with prospect/customer internal security and compliance teams
* Ability to communicate a technical foundation, platform and delivery model in a compelling, creative and easily understandable fashion for diverse audiences (from technical specialists up to C-level)
* Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written.


Basic Qualifications:* 4+ years of expertise with technical knowledge of Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) and Cloud Architectures; preferably in ERP Financials and/or Human Capital Management domains
* 4+ years' experience presenting to technical, business, and executive audiences both in-person and virtually

  

Our Approach to Flexible Work  

With Flex Work, we’re combining the best of both worlds: in-person time and remote. Our approach enables our teams to deepen connections, maintain a strong community, and do their best work. We know that flexibility can take shape in many ways, so rather than a number of required days in-office each week, we simply spend at least half (50%) of our time each quarter in the office or in the field with our customers, prospects, and partners (depending on role). This means you'll have the freedom to create a flexible schedule that caters to your business, team, and personal needs, while being intentional to make the most of time spent together. Those in our remote "home office" roles also have the opportunity to come together in our offices for important moments that matter.
Are you being referred to one of our roles? If so, ask your connection at Workday about our Employee Referral process!
